Message.MsgText: COMPONENT_ALIAS_NOT_SPECIFIED_J2CA0107=J2CA0107I: Component-managed authentication alias not specified for ConnectionFactory or DataSource {0}.
Message.Explanation: The component is accessing the connection factory or data source with res-auth=Application, but no user name or password is available. This might result in an allocateConnection failure.
Message.UserResponse: If a valid user name and password in the ConnectionSpec is passed on the getConnection method, or if the backend resource does not require authentication, this error can be ignored. If you are experiencing problems logging in to the backend resource, use the administrative console to specify a component-managed authentication alias for the specified ConnectionFactory or DataSource.

Message.MsgText: FAILED_GETTING_SUBJECT_J2CA0044=J2CA0044E: The Connection Manager failed to get a Subject from the security service associated with ConnectionFactory {0}. Received exception {1}
Message.Explanation: An internal error occurred when getting a Subject. A container-managed authentication alias might not have been selected on the connection factory or data source.
Message.UserResponse: Check that a valid container-managed authentication alias is specified on the connection factory or data source.

Message.MsgText: MISSING_TRANSACTION_CONTEXT_J2CA0075=J2CA0075W: An active transaction should be present while processing method {0}.
Message.Explanation: Normal connection management processing requires the presence of a transaction in order to run the current method.
Message.UserResponse: Start any transactions that are required to successfully use the connection.

Message.MsgText: CREATE_CONNECTION_FACTORY_EXCP_J2CA0168=J2CA0168E: An exception occurred while trying to instantiate a ConnectionFactory class used by resource {0} : {2}.
Message.Explanation: This indicates a problem while attempting to create a connection factory instance because it caught an Exception from the ManagedConnectionFactory.
Message.UserResponse: Check the exception and contact support for the resource adapter which is throwing the exception.

Message.MsgText: POOL_MANAGER_NOT_FOUND_J2CA0695=J2CA0695E: Unable to find primary pool manager during failover processing for a resource with a JNDI name of {0}.
Message.Explanation: An internal error occurred during failover processing.
Message.UserResponse: If the problem persists, additional information might be available if you search for the message ID on the following Web sites: WebSphere Application Server Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/was/support/ WebSphere Application Server for z/OS Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/zos_os390/support/ .

Message.MsgText: IGNORE_FEATURE_J2CA0240=J2CA0240I: Ignored unimplemented feature {0} for resource {1}.
Message.Explanation: The feature is not implemented by the application server.
Message.UserResponse: No user action is required.

Message.MsgText: NULL_TRAN_WRAPPER_J2CA0057=J2CA0057E: The interactionPending method was unable to find a transaction wrapper class.
Message.Explanation: This is a WebSphere internal error.
Message.UserResponse: If the problem persists, additional information might be available if you search for the message ID on the following Web sites: WebSphere Application Server Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/was/support/ WebSphere Application Server for z/OS Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/zos_os390/support/ .

Message.MsgText: DESERIALIZATION_FIELD_NOT_FOUND_J2CA0278=J2CA0278W: Could not de-serialize field {0} in class {1}; default value will be used
Message.Explanation: During de-serialization of an object, an expected field was not found. This is most likely due to an object that is being de-serialized by a version of the class that is different than the one that serialized the object.
Message.UserResponse: This warning indicates a potential problem, but no user action is necessary unless further errors occur.

Message.MsgText: AUTHENTICATED_SUBJECT_AND_CALLBACK_NOT_SUPPORTED_J2CA0677=J2CA0677E: An authenticated JAAS subject and one or more JASPIC callbacks were passed to the application server by the resource adapter.
Message.Explanation: The resource adapter provided an authenticated JAAS subject to the application server along with one or more JASPIC callbacks. The application server supports the in-flow of authenticated JAAS subjects but only individually and not in combination with the JASPIC callbacks.
Message.UserResponse: Modify the resource adapter configuration or source code to pass in either an authenticated JAAS subject or a valid combination of the JASPIC callbacks and not a combination of both.

Message.MsgText: GET_CONTEXT_CLASSLOADER_ERROR_J2CA0226=J2CA0226E: An exception {0} occured when getting or setting the context classloader. Instance ID: {1}
Message.Explanation: This exception is unexpected. The cause is not immediately known.
Message.UserResponse: If the problem persists, additional information might be available if you search for the message ID on the following Web sites: WebSphere Application Server Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/was/support/ WebSphere Application Server for z/OS Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/zos_os390/support/ .

Message.MsgText: NO_ADMIN_OBJECT_EXCP_J2CA0246=J2CA0246E: There is no administered object in the Reference object for method {0}.
Message.Explanation: There is a problem with the Reference object that was initially stored in the JNDI name space.
Message.UserResponse: If the problem persists, additional information might be available if you search for the message ID on the following Web sites: WebSphere Application Server Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/was/support/ WebSphere Application Server for z/OS Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/zos_os390/support/ .

Message.MsgText: MULTIPLE_RESOURCE_ADAPTERS_INCOMPATIBLE_J2CA0636=J2CA0636I: One or more resource adapters entered were not compatible.
Message.Explanation: One or more of the resource adapters had differing deployment descriptors. They cannot all be updated using the same RAR file.
Message.UserResponse: Check the resource adapters entered and make sure that their deployment descriptor are alike, or update each resource adapter individually.

Message.MsgText: CONFIG_FAILURE_J2CA0242=J2CA0242W: An error was found in the configuration of a resource. The configuration is {0}. The error is {1}.
Message.Explanation: An error occurred while processing the configuration.
Message.UserResponse: Correct the configuration error.

Message.MsgText: NO_SET_METHOD_J2CA0008=J2CA0008W: Class {0} used by resource {2} did not contain method set{1}. Processing continued.
Message.Explanation: There is a missing method on a deployed object. The names of these methods are determined by the name/value pairs contained in the properties of the JavaBean. These are based on the contents of the resource adapter's ra.xml file and class annotations. Processing will continue because the default values for this property might be sufficient, or this particular property might not be required by the specified deployed object.
Message.UserResponse: This error could indicate a mismatch between the resource adapter's XML definition or class annotations and the java class provided for implementation of the JavaBean. Examine the attributes supplied by the resource adapter. It might be necessary to provide this failure notification to the provider of the resource adapter.

Message.MsgText: GET_SOURCE_CLASS_CAST_EXCP_J2CA0098=J2CA0098E: A ClassCastException occurred attempting to cast event.getSource to ManagedConnection: {0}
Message.Explanation: The source of the event fired on the listener was not of type ManagedConnection
Message.UserResponse: If the problem persists, additional information might be available if you search for the message ID on the following Web sites: WebSphere Application Server Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/was/support/ WebSphere Application Server for z/OS Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/zos_os390/support/ .

Message.MsgText: CREATE_DATASOURCE_PROPERTIES_EXCP_J2CA0037=J2CA0037E: An exception occurred when trying to read the Data Source Properties for {0} from the namespace: {1}.
Message.Explanation: An internal error has occurred when reading properties from the namespace.
Message.UserResponse: If the problem persists, additional information might be available if you search for the message ID on the following Web sites: WebSphere Application Server Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/was/support/ WebSphere Application Server for z/OS Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/zos_os390/support/ .

Message.MsgText: FAILED_TO_ASSOCIATE_CONNECTION_J2CA0292=J2CA0292E: The ManagedConnection from resource {0} could not be enlisted with the current transaction.
Message.Explanation: An internal error occurred while processing the lazyEnlist() method.
Message.UserResponse: If the problem persists, additional information might be available if you search for the message ID on the following Web sites: WebSphere Application Server Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/was/support/ WebSphere Application Server for z/OS Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/zos_os390/support/ .

Message.MsgText: NON_TRANSACTIONAL_DS_SHARING_J2CA0657=J2CA0657I: Non-transactional datasource {0} cannot have sharable connections. Switching from shareable to unshareable.
Message.Explanation: The data source was configured as non-transactional. Connection sharing applies only to connections within a transaction.
Message.UserResponse: To avoid this message, modify the res-sharing-scope on resource references to the non-transactional datasource to unshareable.

Message.MsgText: RA_CONNECTION_ERROR_J2CA0056=J2CA0056I: The Connection Manager received a fatal connection error from the Resource Adapter for resource {1}. The exception is: {0}
Message.Explanation: The connection manager has been notified by the resource adapter that an error has occurred on the connection. This informational message is logged so that the user can see the exception that was returned.
Message.UserResponse: The connection manager will remove the failing connection or all the connections from the pool, depending on the configuration. This is normal behavior. If this error appears unexpected, investigate the exception to determine the possible source of the problem.

Message.MsgText: SUGGEST_ENABLE_DCU_J2CA0206=J2CA0206W: A connection error occurred. To help determine the problem, enable the Diagnose Connection Usage option on the Connection Factory or Data Source. This is the multithreaded access detection option. Alternatively check that the Database or MessageProvider is available.
Message.Explanation: When the multithreaded access detection option is enabled, the connection manager will detect and indicate whether the usage of a connection handle violates the JCA programming model. Specifically, the connection manager attempts to detect when a handle is used concurrently on multiple threads, and when a handle is shared within a component instance that is different from the component instance that first created the connection. Multithreaded access detection option is only available for DataSource.
Message.UserResponse: Enable the multithreaded access detection option on the connection factory or data source which created the failing connection handle, restart the application, and recreate the problem. If the server logs or Runtime Messages facility indicates JCA programming model violations, modify the application to not make the connection handle available to any component instance that did not invoke method getConnection(), nor to any code executing on a thread that did not invoke method getConnection().

Message.MsgText: IGNORE_PROPERTY_J2CA0241=J2CA0241I: Ignored property {0} because property {1} is configured on resource {2}.
Message.Explanation: The property is ignored because another property has higher precedence.
Message.UserResponse: No user action is required.

Message.MsgText: RAR_NEW_VERSION_J2CA0638=J2CA0638I: The version of the new Resource Adapter you are updating to is {0}
Message.Explanation: The version of the Resource Adapter you are updating to is specified in the message. This is an informational message only.
Message.UserResponse: None

Message.MsgText: ACTIVATIONSPEC_IMPLEMENTATION_REMOVED_J2CA0642=J2CA0642I: The new RAR file is not compatible with the Resource Adapter. An ActivationSpec class {2} was removed, and there is a configured ActivationSpec that uses the removed type. ActivationSpec name: {0}, JNDI Name: {1}.
Message.Explanation: The new RAR file has removed an ActivationSpec implementation, and the Resource Adapter currently has at least one configured ActivationSpec that makes use of the removed implementation. This makes the Resource Adapter and RAR incompatible for update.
Message.UserResponse: Delete the Activation Specifications that use the implementation class that was removed. The configuration for these objects will be lost.

Message.MsgText: ERROR_HANDLING_CALLBACK_J2CA0672=J2CA0672E: The JASPIC callback handler of the WorkManager failed with exception {0} while handling the callbacks provided by the security context. The exception message is {1}.
Message.Explanation: The WorkManager encountered an exception while handling the JASPIC callbacks provided by the resource adapter within the transferred security context. The exception can be of the following cases: 1) A CallerPrincipalCallback provided a principal with a user name that does not exist in the user registry. 2) A PasswordValidationCallback provided a invalid user name or password. 3) A CallerPrincipalCallback and a PasswordValidationCallback provided different user names. 4) The resource adapter provided a callback that the application server does not currently support. 5) The resource adapter provided more than one CallerPrincipalCallback. 6) The WorkManager encountered an unexpected error.
Message.UserResponse: If the exception message has an error code then check the user action for that error code. If the exception is an UnsupportedCallbackException then contact the resource adapter vendor because the JASPIC callback handler of the WorkManager does not currently support the provided callback. If the exception is not any of the problems mentioned, collect diagnostic data and refer to the IBM support site for additional information.

Message.MsgText: INFINITE_CONNECTION_WAIT_TIMEOUT_J2CA0127=J2CA0127I: A ConnectionWaitTimeout of 0 has been specified for {0}. The request will wait until a connection can be obtained.
Message.Explanation: A ConnectionWaitTimeout of 0 indicates an infinite wait time. This thread will sleep until a connection is freed.
Message.UserResponse: There is no user action required.

Message.MsgText: NO_ALIAS_J2CA0114=J2CA0114W: No container-managed authentication alias found for ConnectionFactory or DataSource {0}.
Message.Explanation: The component did not specify a login configuration on the resource-reference to the connection factory or data source, and no container-managed authentication alias was specified on the connection factory or data source. A Subject with empty user/pw is constructed.
Message.UserResponse: In some cases, this error may be ignored. If you are experiencing problems logging in to the back end resource, define a login configuration on the resource-reference using a deployment tool. Alternatively, use the Integrated Solutions Console or scripting tools to create the connection factory or data source with the proper container-managed authentication alias. Alternatively, if component-managed authentication is desired, change the resource-ref for the component to res-auth=application.

Message.MsgText: BAD_RAKEY_J2CA0029=J2CA0029E: Unable to obtain a ResourceAdapter key while trying to start a ResourceAdapter. The ResourceAdapter configuration information which makes up the key is either missing or corrupted. The following Exception was caught: {0}
Message.Explanation: This might be a symptom of an incorrectly hand-modified resources.xml document. Alternatively, if you are using an application with an embedded resource adapter, this might be a symptom of an incorrectly hand-modified deployment.xml document.
Message.UserResponse: If you have hand-modified either a resources.xml or a deployment.xml file, check the files for any errors. If you have not edited these files, this could be an internal application server error.

Message.MsgText: NO_CONNECTOR_POOL_PROPERTIES_J2CA0006=J2CA0006W: There are no Connection Pooling Properties available for {0}.
Message.Explanation: There is a problem with the Systems Management configuration of the connection factory. The properties for connection pooling do not exist for this connection factory.
Message.UserResponse: If the problem persists, additional information might be available if you search for the message ID on the following Web sites: WebSphere Application Server Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/was/support/ WebSphere Application Server for z/OS Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/zos_os390/support/ .

Message.MsgText: HA_ERROR_J2CA0301=J2CA0301E: ResourceAdapter {0} is not configured properly for High Availability. HA is disabled. Configured HA properties were isEnableHASupport = {1}, and HACapability = {2}.
Message.Explanation: There was a mismatch between isEnableHASupport and the HACapability settings that are configured. Processing continued with high availability disabled.
Message.UserResponse: Check that the resource adapter is configured correctly, that it implements the getHACapability() method, and it has the isEnabledHASupport property.

Message.MsgText: DEST_TYPE_INCOMPATABLE_J2CA0160=J2CA0160W: The type of the destination property on ActivationSpec {0} is {1}. You have supplied a destination JNDI name which requires that the destination type be javax.jms.Destination. These are not compatible. The destination supplied by the destination JNDI name will be ignored.
Message.Explanation: The type of the destination property on the activation specification must be javax.jms.Destination if the destination JNDI name is in use. The type on the activation specification is not compatible with this. The JNDI name will be ignored.
Message.UserResponse: Take appropriate action based on the exception text.

Message.MsgText: CREATE_ADMIN_OBJECT_EXCP_J2CA0247=J2CA0247E: An exception occurred when trying to read the administered object from the namespace: {1}.
Message.Explanation: An internal error has occurred when reading the administered object from the namespace.
Message.UserResponse: If the problem persists, additional information might be available if you search for the message ID on the following Web sites: WebSphere Application Server Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/was/support/ WebSphere Application Server for z/OS Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/zos_os390/support/ .

Message.MsgText: DELIST_RESOURCE_EXCP_J2CA0031=J2CA0031I: Method {0} caught {1} while trying to delist resources from DataSource {3} from the Transaction Manager for the current transaction and threw {2}
Message.Explanation: There was a problem attempting to delist resources from the transaction manager. This message is for informational purposes.
Message.UserResponse: If this message occurs on a regular basis, collect diagnostic information and visit the IBM support site for more information.

Message.MsgText: CFMBEAN_OPERATION_COMPLETED_J2CA0690=J2CA0690I: The {0} operation issued for the resource with a JNDI name of {1} completed successfully.
Message.Explanation: The specified operation completed with no errors.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: ERROR_REGISTERING_MBEAN_J2CA0121=J2CA0121W: An Exception occurred when trying to register an MBean for {0} : {1}.
Message.Explanation: An internal error occurred and the connection manager was unable to create an MBean. The connection factory or the data source will still function, however statistics cannot be accessed through an MBean. This also effects the PMI data that is linked to the MBean.
Message.UserResponse: If the problem persists, additional information might be available if you search for the message ID on the following Web sites: WebSphere Application Server Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/was/support/ WebSphere Application Server for z/OS Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/zos_os390/support/ .

Message.MsgText: SET_METHOD_EXCP_J2CA0036=J2CA0036E: An exception occurred while invoking method set{0} on {1} used by resource {3} : {2}. Processing halted.
Message.Explanation: The set method could not be run. The resource adapter requires this method in order to function correctly. The class files for this ManagedConnectionFactory may be out of date, or there may have been an error communicating between WebSphere systems management and the J2C Runtime.
Message.UserResponse: Check that the class files for this resource adapter are up to date.

Message.MsgText: ALERT_HUNG_MODE_J2CA0514=J2CA0514W: Hung Connection Mode Alert for ConnectionFactory or DataSource {0}. Hung connection blocking has ended.
Message.Explanation: Data sources and connection factories can be configured to decide if operations to the backend are not responding in a timely manner (they are hung) based on the configuration thresholds. When hung mode has been entered the connection manager will block all requests for new connections until it detects that the requests to the backend are responding reasonably. If the hang detection has been configured and this alert is enabled, this message indicates that you have exited the hung connection blocking state, and the creation of new connections is now allowed.
Message.UserResponse: If your connection factory or data source is spending excessive time in a blocked state you might want to verify the configuration parameters or determine if there are other underlying problems with the backend data source.

Message.MsgText: UNSUPPORTED_UPDATE_DIFFERENT_JCA_VERSIONS_J2CA0659=J2CA0659E: Cannot Update a Resource Adapter and RAR of different JCA versions. Resource Adapter JCA version: {0}. RAR File JCA Version: {1}.
Message.Explanation: Updating to a RAR file that is of a different JCA spec version than the Resource Adapter is not supported.
Message.UserResponse: Choose a resource adapter and RAR file which are compatible for update.

Message.MsgText: CONNECTION_POOL_NOT_AVAILABLE_J2CA0165=J2CA0165I: The connection pool is not available. The connection pool is created at first JNDI lookup of a Data Source or Connection Factory.
Message.Explanation: The internal data structures have not been initialized for this connection factory. Some MBean operations are not possible in this state.
Message.UserResponse: Attempt the intended operation after the connection factory has been accessed.

Message.MsgText: RA_STOP_FAILED_J2CA0051=J2CA0051E: The attempt to stop ResourceAdapter {0} failed due to the following exception: {1}
Message.Explanation: An exception occurred while attempting to stop a resource adapter.
Message.UserResponse: Take appropriate action based on the exception text.

Message.MsgText: ILLEGAL_USE_OF_LOCAL_TRANSACTION_J2CA0295=J2CA0295E: The Connection Manager has detected an attempt to start a Local Transaction within a Global (User) Transaction. Check the application code for correctness.
Message.Explanation: This most likely indicates an error in the application. The application should not start local transactions when it is operating in a global transaction.
Message.UserResponse: Examine the application code to determine where a local transaction is started inside a global transaction. Search the FFDC directory for this message to find a stack trace that may include the line numbers of the code in question - this can help to narrow the search. If the line numbers are not found, if the code has been JIT compiled or it is otherwise obfuscated for example, you might want to instrument the code with System.out.println() statements to help find the problem area. If the problem cannot be found visit the IBM support web site.

Message.MsgText: ALERT_HUNG_MODE_J2CA0504=J2CA0504W: Hung Connection Mode Alert for ConnectionFactory or DataSource {0}. Hung connection blocking has started.
Message.Explanation: Data sources and connection factories can be configured to decide if operations to the backend are not responding in a timely manner (they are hung) based on the configuration thresholds. When hung mode has been entered, the connection manager will block all requests for new connections until it detects that the requests to the backend are responding reasonably. If the hang detection has been configured and this alert is enabled, this message indicates that you have entered the hung connection blocking state, and the creation of new connections is not allowed.
Message.UserResponse: If your connection factory or data source is spending excessive time in a blocked state, verify the configuration parameters or investigate for other underlying problems with the backend with which you are trying to communicate.

Message.MsgText: ACTIVATION_STATE_INACTIVE_J2CA0524=J2CA0524I: The Message Endpoint for ActivationSpec {0} and MDB Application {1} is deactivated.
Message.Explanation: The message endpoint exists, and it is disabled from handling incoming messages.
Message.UserResponse: There is no user action required.

Message.MsgText: MULTI_THREADED_HANDLE_USE_J2CA0167=J2CA0167W: An attempt to concurrently use the same connection handle by multiple threads has been detected. The connection handle is: {0}.
Message.Explanation: It is a programming model violation to concurrently access a connection handle from multiple threads.
Message.UserResponse: Do not share a connection handle by multiple threads. A common cause for this error is the storage of the connection in a Static variable. Additionally, since all servlet instance variable behave the same as static variables, another common cause is the storage of a connection in a servlet instance variable.

Message.MsgText: INVALID_PROPERTY_TYPE_J2CA0047=J2CA0047E: Property {0} for class {1} has an invalid type of {2}.
Message.Explanation: Properties for specified class are only allowed to be primitives, or one the following types: java.lang.Character, java.lang.String, java.lang.Boolean, java.lang.Byte, java.lang.Integer, java.lang.Long, java.lang.Float, java.lang.Double.
Message.UserResponse: Ensure the class has implemented the appropriate property type.

Message.MsgText: NO_RA_KEY_EXCP_J2CA0244=J2CA0244E: There is no provider id in the Reference object for method {0}.
Message.Explanation: There is a problem with the Reference object that was initially stored in the JNDI name space.
Message.UserResponse: If the problem persists, additional information might be available if you search for the message ID on the following Web sites: WebSphere Application Server Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/was/support/ WebSphere Application Server for z/OS Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/zos_os390/support/ .

Message.MsgText: AS_LOOKUP_FAILED_J2CA0052=J2CA0052E: The lookup of the Activation Specification with JNDI Name {0} failed due to the following exception: {1}
Message.Explanation: The JNDI lookup of the activation specification failed. This could be caused by one of the following conditions: 1) the activation specification referred to by the specified JNDI name has not been configured, 2) the JNDI Name is incorrect, or 3) some other problem exists as indicated by the exception.
Message.UserResponse: Check that the activation specification is configured for the correct resource adapter. Verify that the JNDI Name specified when deploying your MDB matches the name that was specified when creating the ActivationSpec on the resource adapter.

Message.MsgText: BEAN_VALIDATION_VALIDATOR_UNAVAILABLE_J2CA1007=J2CA1007E: An exception occurred while ValidatorFactory {0} was attempting to provide a Validator : {1}.
Message.Explanation: This exception is unexpected and indicates a problem with the ValidationFactory implementation. The cause may not be immediately determined.
Message.UserResponse: Check the FFDC logs. If the symptom indicates a failure in a ValidatorFactory implementation other than that supplied by WebSphere Application Server, contact the Bean Validation provider. CMSG0002

Message.MsgText: POOL_MANAGER_EXCP_CCF2_0002_J2CA0046=J2CA0046E: Method {0} caught an exception during creation of the ManagedConnection for resource {3}, throwing {2}. Original exception: {1}
Message.Explanation: An error occurred during creation of a ManagedConnection. Usually this can be resolved by looking at the error messages from the resource adapter.
Message.UserResponse: If the problem persists, additional information might be available if you search for the message ID on the following Web sites: WebSphere Application Server Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/was/support/ WebSphere Application Server for z/OS Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/zos_os390/support/ .

Message.MsgText: XA_OP_NOT_SUPPORTED_J2CA0016=J2CA0016E: A two phase XA operation, {0}, was invoked within transaction ID {1}. This Resource Adapter from pool {2} does not support two phase processing.
Message.Explanation: This indicates that an attempt was made to use the connection within the context of an XA transaction along with other XA capable resources. This is not a valid operation for this resource adapter.
Message.UserResponse: Modify the logic to separate the resource usage into separate transactions.

Message.MsgText: MULTIPLE_RESOURCE_ADAPTERS_COMPATIBLE_J2CA0635=J2CA0635I: The Resource Adapters entered are all compatible.
Message.Explanation: All of the resource adapters compared have compatible deployment descriptors, so they can all be updated using the same new RAR file.
Message.UserResponse: None

Message.MsgText: NO_ACTIVATION_CONFIG_PROP_J2CA0306=J2CA0306I: Application {0} has provided no [activation-config-property] for the ActivationSpec class {1} of ResourceAdapter {2}. This may have undesirable effects.
Message.Explanation: No value was supplied for the [activation-config-property]. This may be normal. If a value is required, then not having a value could cause a failure.
Message.UserResponse: Supply a [activation-config-property] if one is required.

Message.MsgText: DESTJNDI_TYPE_WRONG_REQUIRED_J2CA0163=J2CA0163E: The type of the object referred to by the supplied destination JNDI name is wrong. The object must implement javax.jms.destination. Destination is a required property for this Activation Specification. The destination JNDI name was: {0}. The supplied object class was {1}.
Message.Explanation: The type of the destination property on the activation specification must be javax.jms.Destination if the destination JNDI name is in use. The type on the activation specification is not compatible with this. The JNDI name will be ignored.
Message.UserResponse: Supply a destination JNDI name that refers to an adminstered object class that implements the javax.jms.Destination interface.

Message.MsgText: INVALID_CUSTOM_PROP_VALUE_DEFAULT_USED_J2CA0693=J2CA0693W: A value of {0} was specified for the {1} custom property defined for the resource with JNDI name of {2}. The value is not valid. The default value of {3} is being used.
Message.Explanation: A value that is not valid was provided for the custom property being defined. The default value is being used.
Message.UserResponse: Verify that the value for the custom property being defined is valid.

Message.MsgText: XA_RESOURCE_ADAPTER_OPERATION_ID_EXCP_J2CA0027=J2CA0027E: An exception occurred while invoking {0} on an XA Resource Adapter from DataSource {3}, within transaction ID {1} : {2}.
Message.Explanation: There was a problem processing the given method. The processing within the method did not complete successfully.
Message.UserResponse: Check that the business logic of the application is properly catching the exception that was created and that it contains the necessary recovery logic. Also check the log files for earlier errors that caused the exception

Message.MsgText: CONNECTION_CLOSED_NULL_HANDLE_J2CA0148=J2CA0148W: A null ConnectionHandle was found in the CONNECTION_CLOSED ConnectionEvent {0}
Message.Explanation: A CONNECTION_CLOSED ConnectionEvent is required by the Java EE Connector Architecture to contain a valid connection handle associated with the ManagedConnection instance.
Message.UserResponse: The resource adapter must use ConnectionEvent.setConnectionHandle() to supply the connection handle in the CONNECTION_CLOSED ConnectionEvent.

Message.MsgText: SET_METHOD_EXCP_J2CA0007=J2CA0007W: An exception occurred while invoking method set{0} on {1} used by resource {3} : {2}. Processing continued.
Message.Explanation: There was a problem invoking a method on a deployed object. The names of these methods are determined by the name/value pairs contained in the properties of the JavaBean. These are based on the contents of the resource adapter's ra.xml file and class annotations. Processing will continue because the default values for this property might be sufficient, or this particular property might not be required by the specified deployed object.
Message.UserResponse: This error could indicate a mismatch between the resource adapter's XML definition or class annotations and the java class provided for implementation of the JavaBean. Examine the attributes supplied by the resource adapter. It might be necessary to provide this failure notification to the provider of the resource adapter.

Message.MsgText: MULTIPLE_CONNECTION_DEFINITIONS_J2CA0287=J2CA0287E: {0} does not have a single ConnectionDefinition. The program will attempt to continue using the first ConnectionDefinition.
Message.Explanation: There is no connection definition that is defined, or there is more than one connection definition that is defined. There could be an internal XML formatting error.
Message.UserResponse: Ensure that there is only a single connection definition defined.

Message.MsgText: ATTEMPT_TO_SHARE_LTC_CONNECTION_J2CA0086=J2CA0086W: Shareable connection {0} from resource {1} was used within a local transaction containment boundary.
Message.Explanation: Shareable connections are not allowed within a boundary for local transaction containment.
Message.UserResponse: The connection was made non-shareable. This might have adverse effects.

Message.MsgText: ERROR_FINDING_CACHED_PMIDATA_J2CA0111=J2CA0111W: An Error occurred when trying to find a cached instance of J2CPerf.
Message.Explanation: An internal error occurred when trying to obtain a cached instance of J2CPerf.
Message.UserResponse: If the problem persists, additional information might be available if you search for the message ID on the following Web sites: WebSphere Application Server Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/was/support/ WebSphere Application Server for z/OS Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/zos_os390/support/ .

Message.MsgText: WRONG_CLASSLOADER_J2CA0142=J2CA0142E: Classloader is not an instance of CompoundClassLoader.
Message.Explanation: This exception is unexpected. The cause is not immediately known.
Message.UserResponse: If the problem persists, additional information might be available if you search for the message ID on the following Web sites: WebSphere Application Server Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/was/support/ WebSphere Application Server for z/OS Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/zos_os390/support/ .

Message.MsgText: RESOURCEADAPTER_IMPLEMENTATION_CHANGE_J2CA0639=J2CA0639I: The new RAR file is not compatible with the Resource Adapter. The ResourceAdapter implementation class has changed.
Message.Explanation: The new RAR file has a different ResourceAdapter implementation class. This makes the Resource Adapter and RAR incompatible for update.
Message.UserResponse: None

Message.MsgText: MCWRAPPER_GETINSTANCE_ERROR_J2CA0096=J2CA0096E: NullPointerException on setManagedConnection on MCWrapper {0}
Message.Explanation: The attempt to create a new MCWrapper failed, causing a NullPointerException on use.
Message.UserResponse: If the problem persists, additional information might be available if you search for the message ID on the following Web sites: WebSphere Application Server Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/was/support/ WebSphere Application Server for z/OS Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/zos_os390/support/ .

Message.MsgText: FILETRANSFER_ERROR_OCCURRED_J2CA0649=J2CA0649E: An exception occurred while attempting to transfer the RAR file. exception: {0}
Message.Explanation: An error occurred during the file transfer process, and the RAR file could not be sent. The update process cannot continue.
Message.UserResponse: Check the FFDC logs and System.err logs within the {PROFILE_HOME}/logs directory for more information about the exception.

Message.MsgText: NULL_CONNECTOR_NAME_EXCP_J2CA0012=J2CA0012E: The connector name is null in the Reference object for method {0}.
Message.Explanation: There is a problem with the Reference object that was initially stored in the JNDI name space.
Message.UserResponse: If the problem persists, additional information might be available if you search for the message ID on the following Web sites: WebSphere Application Server Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/was/support/ WebSphere Application Server for z/OS Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/zos_os390/support/ .

Message.MsgText: CREATE_CONNECTOR_REFERENCE_EXCP_J2CA0014=J2CA0014I: An exception occurred while building the Reference for JNDI deployment of {0} : {1}. This error was absorbed and a null returned from the method.
Message.Explanation: A problem occured creating the Reference object to be stored in the JNDI name space for the named resource. This problem will be detected and logged as an error later in the processing.
Message.UserResponse: Refer to the additional information that is provided to find related error messages and information from the log file.

Message.MsgText: NULL_OBJECTNAMES_J2CA0112=J2CA0112W: Factory or provider name for {0} was null. The ObjectNames factory : {1} provider : {2} cannot be used by PMI to link the PMI statistics with the MBeans.
Message.Explanation: An internal error has occurred. The MBeans should be created when binding the referenceable object into JNDI and during a JNDI lookup. Both ObjectNames will be set to null and the PMI Data will be created, but will not link with the MBeans. If attempting to look up resources on one server that reside on another, this may be normal behavior. Depending on timing the target server may not have created connection factory MBeans by the time the source server does the JNDI lookup of the connection factory in question. If the MBeans had been created, the PMI data will be created. If the MBeans had not been created, the PMI data will not be created, and the informational message J2CA0112W results. It is also possible that the JNDI name is configured in more than one scope, thus overriding the intended one.
Message.UserResponse: If attempting to look up resources on one server that reside on another, ensure that the target server is running before doing a JNDI lookup of a connection factory or data source.

Message.MsgText: ENLIST_FAILED_J2CA0074=J2CA0074E: Unable to enlist connection from resource {2} with current transaction in method {0} due to exception. Initiating destruction of connection. Exception is: {1}
Message.Explanation: An internal error was received and the connection manager was unable to enlist a connection with the current transaction. The connection manager will attempt to destroy the connection.
Message.UserResponse: If the problem persists, additional information might be available if you search for the message ID on the following Web sites: WebSphere Application Server Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/was/support/ WebSphere Application Server for z/OS Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/zos_os390/support/ .

Message.MsgText: CREATE_METHOD_FAILED_J2CA0068=J2CA0068E: Method {0} could not create {1} instance.
Message.Explanation: An internal error occurred.
Message.UserResponse: This message is due to an error in the internal connection manager processing. Collect diagnostic data and visit the IBM support site for more information.

Message.MsgText: ENLIST_RESOURCE_EXCP_J2CA0030=J2CA0030E: Method {0} caught {1} while trying to enlist resources from DataSource {3} with the Transaction Manager for the current transaction, and threw a {2}.
Message.Explanation: There was a problem processing the given method. The interface defines specific exceptions that can be created, so the exception that was caught was mapped to the exception that was created. The processing within the method did not complete successfully.
Message.UserResponse: Check that the business logic of the application is properly catching the exception that was created and that it contains the necessary recovery logic. Also check the log files for earlier errors that caused the exception.

Message.MsgText: CFMBEAN_OPERATION_EXECUTION_FAILURE_J2CA0688=J2CA0688W: The {0} operation issued for the resource with a JNDI name of {1} failed. Cause: {2}
Message.Explanation: Read the problem description provided as part of the message.
Message.UserResponse: Verify that the operation is for the correct resource.

Message.MsgText: HA_EXCEPTION_RETRIEVING_CAPABILITY_J2CA0309=J2CA0309W: An exception occurred while invoking method returnHACapability() on resource adapter {0}. The configured high availability capability {1} will be used.
Message.Explanation: The high availability capability that is supported by the resource adapter could not be obtained because an unexpected exception occurred when method returnHACapability() was invoked for the specified resource adapter. The connection manager will use the high availability setting that is already configured.
Message.UserResponse: This is an exception within the resource adapter. See the support Web site for the resource adapter provider for more information.

Message.MsgText: REQUIRED_PROPERTY_MISSING_J2CA0282=J2CA0282W: Required property {0} was missing from the Activation Specification.
Message.Explanation: The required property was missing from the activation specification.
Message.UserResponse: Supply a correct property in the activation specification

Message.MsgText: ERROR_READING_DS_MBEAN_PROPS_J2CA0119=J2CA0119W: An Exception occurred when reading properties for a Data Source MBean {0}.
Message.Explanation: Usually this means an internal error has occurred. The MBean for the data source will not have all the information that you might expect (some operations will return bad values). The data source instance managed by the MBean is still useable, and this warning will not adversely effect any applications.
Message.UserResponse: If the problem persists, additional information might be available if you search for the message ID on the following Web sites: WebSphere Application Server Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/was/support/ WebSphere Application Server for z/OS Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/zos_os390/support/ .

Message.MsgText: CREATE_ACTIVATION_SPEC_FAILED_J2CA0129=J2CA0129E: An exception occurred while trying to instantiate the ActivationSpec class {0} used by ResourceAdapter {1} : {2}.
Message.Explanation: There was a problem attempting to create the ActivationSpec JavaBean instance. There are several possible reasons for this problem. The most common reason is that the connection manager could not find the class for the activation specification using the context class loader. This error could also be related to a resource adapter XML definition which is not valid.
Message.UserResponse: If the problem persists, additional information might be available if you search for the message ID on the following Web sites: WebSphere Application Server Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/was/support/ WebSphere Application Server for z/OS Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/zos_os390/support/ .

Message.MsgText: HANDLE_NOT_CLOSED_J2CA0055=J2CA0055W: Connection handle not closed at end of the unit of work scope. Handles will be closed by the Connection Manager.
Message.Explanation: Either an activity session, transaction, or local transaction work scope is ending and connection handles are not closed. Support for caching handles outside of the current unit of work scope is not supported for this configuration or release.
Message.UserResponse: Inspect your application and ensure that the connection handles are closed before the associated unit of work ends.

Message.MsgText: FIND_OTHER_RAS_NONNODE_TARGET_J2CA0655=J2CA0655E: The findOtherRAsToUpdate command can only be called specifying a node scoped resource adapter.
Message.Explanation: Resource adapters in other scopes are only copies of node scoped resource adapters.
Message.UserResponse: Specify a node scoped resource adapter on the command to find copies that need to be updated.

Message.MsgText: DEST_DOES_NOT_EXIST_J2CA0162=J2CA0162W: You have supplied a destination JNDI name for ActivationSpec {0}. This ActivationSpec class lacks the setDestination() method. The destination JNDI Name will be ignored.
Message.Explanation: You do not need to supply a destination JNDI name.
Message.UserResponse: Do not supply a destination JNDI name.

Message.MsgText: EXECUTION_CALLBACK_SUBJECT_MISMATCH_J2CA0673=J2CA0673W: The execution subject provided by the WorkManager does not match the subject supplied by the {0}.
Message.Explanation: The instance of the execution subject provided by the WorkManager to establish the security context of the Work instance is not the same instance obtained from the respective callback. The WorkManager ignored the subject obtained from the callback and continued to establish the security context using the instance it provided.
Message.UserResponse: Contact the resource adapter vendor to modify the JASPIC callback's getSubject() method to return the execution subject provided to the SecurityContext instance through the call to method setupSecurityContext.

Message.MsgText: SYSTEM_PROPERTY_NOT_FOUND_J2CA0228=J2CA0228E: System property {0} not found.
Message.Explanation: The expected system property cannot be found. This may cause subsequent failures.
Message.UserResponse: If the problem persists, additional information might be available if you search for the message ID on the following Web sites: WebSphere Application Server Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/was/support/ WebSphere Application Server for z/OS Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/zos_os390/support/ .

Message.MsgText: PATH_EXPAND_FAILED_J2CA0042=J2CA0042E: An Exception occurred while trying to expand part of a path. The failing piece is {0}. The exception is: {1}
Message.Explanation: Check the path string that failed and verify that any non-expanded variables are valid (including their case).
Message.UserResponse: Fix any variables which are not valid.

Message.MsgText: SECURITY_CONTEXT_NOT_ASSOCIATED_J2CA0671=J2CA0671E: The WorkManager was unable to associate the provided SecurityContext to the Work instance.
Message.Explanation: The WorkManager encountered a problem while establishing and setting up the security context for the inbound Work request.
Message.UserResponse: Check the FFDC and server logs for messages J2CA0668E and J2CA0669E to determine the cause.

Message.MsgText: NO_RA_EXCEPTION_J2CA0216=J2CA0216I: The Connection Manager received a fatal connection error from the Resource Adapter for resource {0}. Information may be available in previous messages or exceptions.
Message.Explanation: The connection manager has been notified by the resource adapter that an unrecoverable error has occurred on the connection. No exception was received from the resource adapter.
Message.UserResponse: The connection manager will remove the failing connection, or all the connections (depending on configuration) from the pool. This is normal behavior. If this causes adverse effects, it may be necessary to contact the resource adapter supplier.

Message.MsgText: BAD_CFKEY_J2CA0072=J2CA0072E: Unable to obtain a Connection Factory or Data Source configuration ID while trying to start a ResourceAdapter. The Connection Factory or Data Source configuration information which makes up the ID is either missing or corrupted. The following Exception was caught: {0}
Message.Explanation: This might be a error associated with a hand-modified resources.xml document. Alternatively, if you are using an application with an embedded resource adapter, this might be a error associated with a hand-modified deployment.xml document.
Message.UserResponse: If the resources.xml or a deployment.xml file has been modified by hand, verify that there are no errors. If you have not edited these files, this could be an internal error.

Message.MsgText: CLASS_CAST_EXCEPTION_J2CA0065=J2CA0065E: ClassCastException tried to cast : {0} to {1}. {2}
Message.Explanation: This is an internal error.
Message.UserResponse: If the problem persists, additional information might be available if you search for the message ID on the following Web sites: WebSphere Application Server Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/was/support/ WebSphere Application Server for z/OS Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/zos_os390/support/ .

Message.MsgText: CREATE_MCF_PROPERTIES_EXCP_J2CA0038=J2CA0038E: An exception occurred when trying to read the ManagedConnectionFactory Properties for {0} from the namespace: {1}.
Message.Explanation: An internal error has occurred when reading properties from the namespace.
Message.UserResponse: If the problem persists, additional information might be available if you search for the message ID on the following Web sites: WebSphere Application Server Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/was/support/ WebSphere Application Server for z/OS Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/zos_os390/support/ .

Message.MsgText: USING_DEFAULT_THREAD_POOL_J2CA0290=J2CA0290W: Thread pool {0} will be used.
Message.Explanation: The thread pool that was specified for the resource adapter has not been configured.
Message.UserResponse: Configure the missing thread pool.

Message.MsgText: BEAN_VALIDATION_SERVICE_UNAVAILABLE_J2CA1004=J2CA1004E: RAR Bean Validation has been disabled, because the BeanValidationService is unavailable. Validation constraints of RAR JavaBean instances will not be validated before the instances are placed into service.
Message.Explanation: This indicates an unexpected problem with the BeanValidationService. The cause may not be immediately determined.
Message.UserResponse: If the problem persists, additional information might be available if you search for the message ID on the following Web sites: WebSphere Application Server Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/was/support/ WebSphere Application Server for z/OS Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/zos_os390/support/ .

Message.MsgText: NULL_RA_KEY_EXCP_J2CA0245=J2CA0245E: The provider id is null in the Reference object for method {0}.
Message.Explanation: There is a problem with the Reference object that was initially stored in the JNDI name space.
Message.UserResponse: If the problem persists, additional information might be available if you search for the message ID on the following Web sites: WebSphere Application Server Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/was/support/ WebSphere Application Server for z/OS Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/zos_os390/support/ .

Message.MsgText: WAS40_DS_ISOLATION_UNSUPPORTED_J2CA0218=J2CA0218E: Version 4 data sources are not supported for isolated JDBC providers. The data source name is: {0}
Message.Explanation: You cannot configure a Version 4 data source under this JDBC provider because the provider is configured to be isolated.
Message.UserResponse: Set this JDBC provider to not be isolated, or configure this Version 4 data source under a JDBC provider that is not configured to be isolated.

Message.MsgText: CREATE_DETAILS_FAILED_J2CA0019=J2CA0019W: No Managed Connection Factory Properties data could be assembled for {0}. Processing continued.
Message.Explanation: The properties for the ManagedConnectionFactory could not be assembled because of other logged errors. This might cause problems at runtime, depending on the default values of the various properties that are provided by the resource adapter.
Message.UserResponse: Check for other related messages that could further explain the specific problems with the property data. If your connections appear to work, you may ignore this message. Otherwise, attempt to follow the "User Response" sections in the other error messages.

Message.MsgText: ERROR_CLEANUP_MC_J2CA0062=J2CA0062W: Encountered an error while cleaning up the ManagedConnection {0} : {1}
Message.Explanation: The cleanup operation on a managed connection failed. The connection could not be cleaned up after recovery.
Message.UserResponse: If the problem persists, additional information might be available if you search for the message ID on the following Web sites: WebSphere Application Server Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/was/support/ WebSphere Application Server for z/OS Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/zos_os390/support/ .

Message.MsgText: GET_CONFIGPROPERTY_FAILED_J2CA0066=J2CA0066E: Failed calling get method {0} on the ManagedConnectionFactory {1} used by resource {4} with the value {2}. Exception is {3}.
Message.Explanation: The resource adapter does not support the getter method as documented.
Message.UserResponse: Visit the support site for the developer of the resource adapter.

Message.MsgText: CALLBACK_SECURITY_NAME_MISMATCH_J2CA0675=J2CA0675E: The user name {0}, provided by the PasswordValidationCallback, and the user name {1}, provided by the CallerPrincipalCallback, do not match.
Message.Explanation: User names provided by the PasswordValidationCallback and the CallerPrincipalCallback must match.
Message.UserResponse: Contact the resource adapter vendor and the system administrator to ensure that the resource adapter is designed and configured to return the same user name from the two callbacks.

Message.MsgText: EXCEPTION_DURING_COMPARISON_J2CA0644=J2CA0644E: An exception occurred while retrieving class changes for the comparison.
Message.Explanation: The Resource Adapter comparison was unable to complete.
Message.UserResponse: Check the FFDC logs and System.err logs within the {PROFILE_HOME}/logs directory for more information about the exception.

Message.MsgText: POOL_MANAGER_EXCP_CCF2_0001_J2CA0045=J2CA0045E: Connection not available while invoking method {0} for resource {1}.
Message.Explanation: A connection wait timeout has occurred. A ConnectionWaitTimeoutException was created.
Message.UserResponse: Reconfigure the connection pool. Increase the maximum number of connections or increase the connection wait time to avoid this error.

Message.MsgText: NULL_LOCAL_TRAN_J2CA0097=J2CA0097E: The call to ContainerComponentMetaData.getLocalTran returned null: {0}.
Message.Explanation: An unexpected null value was returned from ContainerComponentMetaData.getLocalTran().
Message.UserResponse: If the problem persists, additional information might be available if you search for the message ID on the following Web sites: WebSphere Application Server Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/was/support/ WebSphere Application Server for z/OS Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/zos_os390/support/ .

Message.MsgText: ATTEMPT_TO_DESTORY_CONNECTION_IN_USE_J2CA0088=J2CA0088W: The ManagedConnection that is being destroyed from resource {1} is in an invalid state {0}. Processing will continue.
Message.Explanation: An internal error has occurred.
Message.UserResponse: If the problem persists, additional information might be available if you search for the message ID on the following Web sites: WebSphere Application Server Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/was/support/ WebSphere Application Server for z/OS Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/zos_os390/support/ .

Message.MsgText: FORCEFULLY_DEACTIVING_ENDPOINTS_J2CA0049=J2CA0049W: ResourceAdapter {0} is being stopped with message endpoints still activated. These enpoints will be forcefully deactivated.
Message.Explanation: Resource adapters should be stopped only after all message endpoints have been deactivated. Message endpoints are deactivated when the application that is supplying the message endpoint is stopped. Currently, only MDB can be a message endpoint.
Message.UserResponse: Stop any applications that contain message endpoints that are associated with a particular resource adapter before you stop that resource adapter.

Message.MsgText: NODE_AGENT_NOT_RUNNING_J2CA0696=J2CA0696E: The node-scoped resource adapter {0} could not be updated, because the node agent on node {1} of cell {2} is not running.
Message.Explanation: The node agent for the selected node must be running in order to update a node-scoped resource adapter using the deployment manager.
Message.UserResponse: Start the node agent, and retry the update operation.

Message.MsgText: PROPERTY_TYPE_MISMATCH_J2CA0281=J2CA0281W: When merging user-defined property {0}, its type, {1}, did not match the type of the merged config and introspected properties, {2}. Keeping the merged config and introspected type.
Message.Explanation: User-defined properties of a resource adapter or an activation specification will override their corresponding introspected and configuration properties unless the type does not match.
Message.UserResponse: Check the type of the user-defined configuration property.

Message.MsgText: XML_FORMAT_ERROR_J2CA0126=J2CA0126W: Invalid format for value of element {0} in node {1} of XML document {2}. Returning {3}.
Message.Explanation: The XML document is not formed correctly.
Message.UserResponse: See the XML document for possible errors.

Message.MsgText: PROPERTY_TYPE_MISMATCH_J2CA0280=J2CA0280W: When merging config property {0}, its type, {1}, did not match the introspected type, {2}. Keeping the introspected type.
Message.Explanation: Configuration properties of a resource adapter or activation specification override their corresponding introspected properties, unless the type does not match.
Message.UserResponse: Check the type of the configuration property.

Message.MsgText: FREEPOOL_GETFREECONNECTION_ERROR_J2CA1002=J2CA1002E: Invalid MCWrapper {0} from the free pool for resource {1}.
Message.Explanation: The attempt to reserve an MCWrapper failed.
Message.UserResponse: If the problem persists, additional information might be available if you search for the message ID on the following Web sites: WebSphere Application Server Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/was/support/ WebSphere Application Server for z/OS Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/zos_os390/support/ .

Message.MsgText: ACTIVATION_HA_INBOUND_DISABLED_J2CA0526=J2CA0526I: The Message Endpoint for ActivationSpec {0} and MDB Application {1} cannot be activated nor deactivated because inbound messaging on ResourceAdapter {2} is currently disabled by the High_Availability (HA) Manager.
Message.Explanation: The HA Manager controls the activation of inbound messaging for resource adapters that have enabled HA capability. Message endpoints can be paused and resumed after the HA manager activates inbound messaging on the resource adapter.
Message.UserResponse: Avoid pausing or resuming message endpoints that are not yet activated by the HA manager.

Message.MsgText: TRAN_RECOVERY_SETUP_FAILURE_J2CA0048=J2CA0048E: The setup of XA Transaction recovery for inbound message support did not complete for ResourceAdapter {0}. The following exception was caught: {1}
Message.Explanation: The server could not enable transaction recovery for this resource adapter. The possible causes include: errors in the archive, class, or native paths; internal server errors.
Message.UserResponse: Validate your archive, class, and native paths on the connection factory.

Message.MsgText: REACTIVATION_FAILED_J2CA0156=J2CA0156E: The Message Endpoint re-activation failed during a resume operation on a ResourceAdapter. The ActivationSpec was {0}, the MDB Application was {1}, and the exception was: {2}
Message.Explanation: This exception is unexpected. The cause is not immediately known.
Message.UserResponse: See the exception and other log entries for more details.

Message.MsgText: AS_ALIAS_LOOKUP_FAILED_J2CA0155=J2CA0155W: The lookup of the AuthenticationAlias {0}, assigned to the ActivationSpec {1} by application {2} has failed.
Message.Explanation: The activation specification in use by the given MDB had an authentication alias which failed to return a valid credential object.
Message.UserResponse: Check that the authentication alias has been properly configured and assigned to the activation specification configuration, or specified as part of the MDB deployment step.

Message.MsgText: UNEXPECTED_UPDATE_EXCEPTION_J2CA0646=J2CA0646E: An unexpected exception occurred in the Update service, exception: {0}
Message.Explanation: An unexpected exception occurred in the Update service.
Message.UserResponse: Check the FFDC logs and System.err logs within the {PROFILE_HOME}/logs directory for more information about the exception.

Message.MsgText: TRANSACTION_SYNCHRONIZATION_REGISTRY_UNAVAILABLE_J2CA0316=J2CA0316E: The application server is unable to make an instance of the TransactionSynchronizationRegistry available to the BootstrapContext for provider id {0}.
Message.Explanation: The BootstrapContext was unable to return a TransactionSynchronizationRegistry to the resource adapter due to an internal problem. The resource adapter cannot directly interact with the Transaction Manager until the problem is resolved.
Message.UserResponse: Please review the FFDC log files for potential actions to resolve this problem.

Message.MsgText: ERROR_EXTRACTING_ARCHIVE_J2CA0651=J2CA0651E: An exception occurred while attempting to extract the archive {0} to {1}. Exception: {2}
Message.Explanation: An exception occurred while attempting to extract the rar file to the destination location. The exception information may relate to a remote node if the update was being performed on a remote Resource Adapter.
Message.UserResponse: Check the FFDC logs and System.err logs within the {PROFILE_HOME}/logs directory for the local machine. If attempting to update a resource adapter on a remote node, check the logs on that node as well.

Message.MsgText: HA_WARNING_J2CA0303=J2CA0303E: Attempting to {0} ResourceAdapter {1} while under HA control.
Message.Explanation: This indicates a suspend/resume operation was attempted while high availability is enabled. Only outbound portions of the resource adapter will be suspended or resumed.
Message.UserResponse: If the problem persists, additional information might be available if you search for the message ID on the following Web sites: WebSphere Application Server Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/was/support/ WebSphere Application Server for z/OS Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/zos_os390/support/ .

Message.MsgText: NO_RESOURCE_ADAPTER_DD_J2CA0002=J2CA0002W: There is no Resource Adapter Deployment Descriptor available for {0}.
Message.Explanation: There is a problem with the Systems Management configuration for the resource adapter. A deployment descriptor does not exist for this resource adapter.
Message.UserResponse: Check that file resources.xml exists and that it contains a [resourceProviders xmi:type="resources.j2c:J2CResourceAdapter" . . .] element. If the file does not exist, or if the file appears to be incorrect, delete it and re-create the resource adapter through the Integrated Solutions Console.

Message.MsgText: INVALID_ACTIVATION_CONFIG_PROP_J2CA0131=J2CA0131E: Application {0} has an [activation-config-property], {1}, which is not valid for the ActivationSpec class {2} of ResourceAdapter {3} and cannot be set. This may have undesirable effects.
Message.Explanation: A set method does not exist for listed [activation-config-property] on the ActivationSpec JavaBean class of the given resource adapter. This could be caused by: (1) the application's MDB was mapped to the wrong ActivationSpec class or MessageListenerType, (2) there is a case mismatch between the [activation-config-property] name and the actual method, or (3) the application assembler entered a non-existing property.
Message.UserResponse: Redeploy the application and correct any mapping errors, or reassemble the application with valid [activation-config-property] values.

Message.MsgText: ATTEMPT_TO_USE_PRETEST_CONNECTION_J2CA0286=J2CA0286W: Connection {0} from resource {1} cannot be used with pretest connection configured. Turning off pretest connection support for this Resource Adapter.
Message.Explanation: This connection's resource adapter does not support the pretest connection function.
Message.UserResponse: Reconfigure pretest connection to false for this resource adapter.

Message.MsgText: ERROR_CREATE_PMIDATA_J2CA0279=J2CA0279W: An Error occurred when trying to create pmi data.
Message.Explanation: This exception is unexpected. The cause is not immediately known.
Message.UserResponse: If the problem persists, additional information might be available if you search for the message ID on the following Web sites: WebSphere Application Server Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/was/support/ WebSphere Application Server for z/OS Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/zos_os390/support/ .

Message.MsgText: CREATE_RA_CONNECTION_FACTORY_EXCP_J2CA0018=J2CA0018E: An exception occurred while trying to create Resource Adapter ConnectionFactory {0} : {1}.
Message.Explanation: There was a problem with the resource adapter creating the desired connection factory. The exception text provides additional details on the actual problem.
Message.UserResponse: If the exception text does not indicate a situation that is user controlled, collect diagnostic data and refer to the IBM support site for additional information.

Message.MsgText: NONEXISTENT_ACTIVATION_CONFIG_PROP_J2CA0291=J2CA0291I: Application {0} has an <activation-config-property>, {1}, for which there is no corresponding property on the ActivationSpec class {2} of ResourceAdapter {3}. This property will be ignored. This may have undesirable effects.
Message.Explanation: The application EAR file has supplied an [activation-config-property] that does not exist.
Message.UserResponse: Fix the application descriptor.

Message.MsgText: FAILED_TO_ASSOCIATE_CONNECTION_J2CA0058=J2CA0058E: The ConnectionManager was unable to associate Connection {0} with ManagedConnection {1} for resource {3}. Received exception: {2}
Message.Explanation: This is most likely an application error. An example: A cached connection is enlisted in a transaction, then the connection is closed. Before the transaction completes another request it is sent to the same EJB that originally opened the connection. The cached handle is still associated with the original transaction and cannot be re-associated until that transaction commits.
Message.UserResponse: Inspect the application and ensure that the transaction is committed as soon as possible after connections are closed.

Message.MsgText: PROPERTY_NOT_FOUND_J2CA0284=J2CA0284W: Resource property {0} is skipped.
Message.Explanation: The property was not found through introspection on the underlying bean.
Message.UserResponse: Compare this property in the ra.xml file and the JavaBean.

Message.MsgText: UNABLE_TO_INITIALIZE_WM_J2CA0135=J2CA0135E: Unable to initialize a WorkManager for provider id: {1} with the following thread pool: {0}, due to an exception. The exception will not be re-thrown. The exception is: {2}.
Message.Explanation: The BootstrapContext was unable to return a WorkManager to the resource adapter due to a problem configuring the WorkManager.
Message.UserResponse: See the exception and previous log entries for more details.

Message.MsgText: ALERT_SERIAL_REUSE_VIOLATION_J2CA0511=J2CA0511W: Serial Reuse Violation Alert for ConnectionFactory or DataSource {0}. An attempt to concurrently share a connection within an Local Transaction Containment boundary has been detected. This is a violation of the Serial Reuse Alert checking. If callstack capture is enabled the callstack at the time the connection was requested will be provided in the alert contents.
Message.Explanation: When applications manage interactions with the backend data source, two connections that are mapped to a single managed connection can cause data integrity problems, because there is no owner that is in charge of the commit or rollback calls. If this is attempted, the second managed connection will be returned. If this is unexpected it might cause data integrity problems, and it might cause the use of additional connections. This alert can help detect such situations and provide information that might help determine the problem.
Message.UserResponse: For more information consult the documentation on the rules for sharing connection with local transaction containment.

Message.MsgText: PROPERTY_NAME_NOT_FOUND_J2CA0665=J2CA0665E: The connection factory does not have a property with the name {0}.
Message.Explanation: The connection factory does not have a property with the specified name. Possible reasons for the error are the property name is misspelled or incorrectly capitalized, or the specified property does not apply to the connection factory being configured.
Message.UserResponse: Verify the property name for the connection factory. Correct any errors in spelling or capitalization.

Message.MsgText: CWTE_RESERVE_POOL_J2CA1011=J2CA1011E: Connection not available; timed out waiting for {0} seconds. Enabling a reserve pool could decrease the number of connection wait timeout exceptions.
Message.Explanation: This occurrs when a connection can not be obtained to a data source. By enabling a reserve pool, the number of connection wait timeout exceptions could decrease, thus increasing performance.
Message.UserResponse: No user action required.

Message.MsgText: INVALID_EJB_COMPONENT_J2CA0102=J2CA0102E: Invalid EJB component: Cannot use an EJB module with version {0} using {1}.
Message.Explanation: An attempt to run an EJB component that is incompatible with the application server.
Message.UserResponse: Evaluate the EJB version supported by the EJB component, correct any errors that might be present, and redeploy the component.

Message.MsgText: CONFIG_PROPERTY_CHANGED_J2CA0288=J2CA0288I: Configuration property {0} changed from {1} to {2} for pool {3}
Message.Explanation: A pool properties value has changed.
Message.UserResponse: There is no user action required.

Message.MsgText: DESTJNDI_TYPE_WRONG_J2CA0161=J2CA0161W: The type of the object referred to by the supplied destination JNDI name is wrong. The object must implement javax.jms.destination. The destination JNDI name was: {0}. The supplied object class was: {1}
Message.Explanation: The type of the destination property on the activation specification must be javax.jms.Destination if the destination JNDI name is in use. The type on the activation specification is not compatible with this. The JNDI name will be ignored.
Message.UserResponse: Take appropriate action based on the exception text.

Message.MsgText: INVALID_ACTIVATION_CONFIG_PROP2_J2CA0315=J2CA0315W: The Message Endpoint for ActivationSpec {0} and MDB Application {1} has given an invalid value for the custom property WAS_EndpointInitialState.
Message.Explanation: The value provided for the custom property WAS_EndpointInitialState is not valid. Hence this property will be ignored.
Message.UserResponse: Use the administrative console or the wsadmin tool to provide a valid value for the custom property [ACTIVE or INACTIVE].

Message.MsgText: DELIST_FAILED_J2CA0073=J2CA0073E: Unable to delist connection from resource {2} from transaction in method {0} due to exception. Initiating destruction of connection. Exception is: {1}
Message.Explanation: An internal error was received and the connection manager was not able to delist a connection from the transaction in which it was involved. The connection manager will attempt to destroy the connection.
Message.UserResponse: If the problem persists, additional information might be available if you search for the message ID on the following Web sites: WebSphere Application Server Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/was/support/ WebSphere Application Server for z/OS Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/zos_os390/support/ .

Message.MsgText: NULL_REQUIRED_OBJECT_J2CA0109=J2CA0109E: Method {0} obtained a NULL {1} where a required object was expected. Throwing exception {2}.
Message.Explanation: This exception is unexpected. The cause is not immediately known.
Message.UserResponse: If the problem persists, additional information might be available if you search for the message ID on the following Web sites: WebSphere Application Server Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/was/support/ WebSphere Application Server for z/OS Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/zos_os390/support/ .

Message.MsgText: UNABLE_TO_START_RA_J2CA0145=J2CA0145W: Unable to start ResourceAdapter due to the following exception: {0}.
Message.Explanation: The server was unable to start a resource adapter.
Message.UserResponse: See the exception and previous log entries for more information.

Message.MsgText: FAILED_CONNECTION_J2CA0021=J2CA0021E: An exception occurred while trying to get a Connection from the Managed Connection resource {1} : {0}.
Message.Explanation: The resource adapter created an exception when attempting to call the getConnection() method. The exception text might provide additional information for determining the problem.
Message.UserResponse: If there are no user controlled indications, the message might be due to an internal error in connection manager processing. Collect diagnostic data and visit the IBM support site for more information.

Message.MsgText: EXCEPTION_RETRIEVING_CLASS_PROPERTIES_J2CA0643=J2CA0643E: An exception occurred while attempting to retrieve the class names and properties for type {0}, exception was: {1}
Message.Explanation: An exception occurred while attempting to retrieve the lists of class names and properties for comparison.
Message.UserResponse: Check the FFDC logs and System.err logs within the {PROFILE_HOME}/logs directory for more information about the exception. Make sure that you have enough access privileges to run the command.

Message.MsgText: INVALID_ACTIVATION_CONFIG_PROP2_J2CA0305=J2CA0305E: Application {0} has an [activation-config-property] which is NULL or blank and is not valid for the ActivationSpec class {1} of ResourceAdapter {2} and cannot be set. This may have undesirable effects.
Message.Explanation: The application assembler entered a property that does not exist or one that is poorly formatted [activation-config-property].
Message.UserResponse: Reassemble the application with a [activation-config-property] that is valid.

Message.MsgText: ALERT_POOL_LOAD_J2CA0508=J2CA0508W: Pool Load Alert for ConnectionFactory or DataSource {0}. The average connection load (or demand) over approximately the last {1} minutes has exceeded your configured threshold of {2}.
Message.Explanation: A connection factory or data source has a maximum available load that is equal to all of its connections that are in continuous use. This equals its current maxConnections setting. At any point, the pool load is the number of connections in use in addition to any threads that are waiting for a connection. The average pool load is average time of the pool load divided by the interval that is configured by this alert. This alert indicates that you have exceeded the pool average load for the last interval.
Message.UserResponse: Excessive load on the pool might be caused by a number of factors, including a maxConnnections setting that is too low, a connection percent efficiency that is too low and causes poor connection utilization, or a demand that is outstripping its capacity. Investigate any possible problems and make the appropriate changes.

Message.MsgText: MCERROR_J2CA0081=J2CA0081E: Method {0} failed while trying to execute method {1} on ManagedConnection {2} from resource {4}. Caught exception: {3}
Message.Explanation: The connection manager caught an exception while trying to perform an operation on a ManagedConnection.
Message.UserResponse: Since the ManagedConnection is part of the resource adapter, look for messages from the resource adapter to further isolate the problem.

Message.MsgText: CREATE_METHOD_FAILED2_J2CA0069=J2CA0069E: Method {0} could not create {1} instance. Failed with exception: {2}
Message.Explanation: An internal error occurred.
Message.UserResponse: This message is an internal error in the connection manager processing. Collect diagnostic data and visit the IBM support site for more information.

Message.MsgText: UNEXPECTED_RA_FOR_DATASOURCE_J2CA0217=J2CA0217E: The {0} data source is associated with a resource adapter that is not the built-in relational resource adapter (RRA). The configuration ID for the resource adapter that is not correct is {1}.
Message.Explanation: If you configured a data source with scripting, the relationalResourceAdapter attribute might have not been set correctly.
Message.UserResponse: Check your configuration script to ensure that relationalResourceAdapter is set to "builtin_rra".

Message.MsgText: ACTIVATION_FAILED_J2CA0138=J2CA0138E: The Message Endpoint activation failed for ActivationSpec {0} and MDB application {1} due to the following exception: {2}
Message.Explanation: This exception is unexpected. The cause is not immediately known.
Message.UserResponse: See the exception and other log entries for more details.

Message.MsgText: DEACTIVATION_FAILED_J2CA0140=J2CA0140W: The Message Endpoint pause operation failed for ActivationSpec {0} and MDB Application {1} because the endpoint is currently deactivated, stopped, or an unexpected exception occurred deactivating the endpoint.
Message.Explanation: Message endpoints that are stopped or deactivated cannot be paused.
