Message.UserResponse: Ensure that the message endpoint is activated before invoking the pause operation. If the endpoint is activated, check the exception and other log entries for more details.

Message.MsgText: SET_ONCE_PROP_ALREADY_SET_J2CA0159=J2CA0159E: Internal error. An attempt has been made to change a set once property that has already been set. The property name is {0}
Message.Explanation: This exception is unexpected. The cause is not immediately known.
Message.UserResponse: If the problem persists, additional information might be available if you search for the message ID on the following Web sites: WebSphere Application Server Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/was/support/ WebSphere Application Server for z/OS Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/zos_os390/support/ .

Message.MsgText: REQUIRED_PROPERTY_NOT_SET_J2CA0133=J2CA0133E: For the installed ResourceAdapter {0} and ActivationSpec {1}, required activation specification properties were missing from the activation-config-properties for the MDB being activated. See the following exception for details: {2}
Message.Explanation: The resource adapter marks certain activation specification properties as required, and the value was not supplied. These properties can be set from two different places: (1) when you create an activation specification configuration object under the installed resource adapter, and (2) from the application itself as an <activation-config-property>, which may be modified using the application assembly tool.
Message.UserResponse: Supply the required values on the activation specification, which is configured on the installed resource adapter, or in an [activation-config-property] entry within the application.

Message.MsgText: DEACTIVATION_FAILED_J2CA0139=J2CA0139E: The Message Endpoint deactivation failed for ActivationSpec {0} and MDB application {1} due to the following exception: {2}
Message.Explanation: This exception is unexpected. The cause is not immediately known.
Message.UserResponse: See the exception and other log entries for more details.

Message.MsgText: AS_JNDINAME_MISSING_J2CA0054=J2CA0054E: The Message Endpoint activation failed because no Activation Specification JNDI name was supplied.
Message.Explanation: In order to activate a message endpoint (MDB) a JNDI name to a configured activation specification must be supplied during MDB deployment.
Message.UserResponse: Check that the activation specification had been configured for the resource adapter you are using. Verify that the JNDI Name specified when deploying your MDB matches that specified when creating the application Spec on the ResourceAdapter.

Message.MsgText: ALERT_CONN_ERROR_J2CA0500=J2CA0500W: Connection Error Alert for ConnectionFactory or DataSoure {0}. This ConnectionFactory or DataSoure has exceeded {1} connection error events in less than {2} minutes.
Message.Explanation: The 'connErrorAlert' has been enabled for this connection factory or data source. The configuration has optional parameters for indicating a time interval and a threshold for the alert so that the message is issued if the number of connection errors that are observed during the time interval by the connection factory or data source exceeds the threshold.
Message.UserResponse: If the frequency of connection errors is excessive, investigate the root cause of connection errors, starting with the error log.

Message.MsgText: NO_CONNECTOR_PROPERTIES_J2CA0004=J2CA0004W: There are no Connection Factory Properties available for {0}.
Message.Explanation: There is a problem with the Systems Management configuration of the connection factory. The properties do not exist for this connection factory.
Message.UserResponse: If the problem persists, additional information might be available if you search for the message ID on the following Web sites: WebSphere Application Server Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/was/support/ WebSphere Application Server for z/OS Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/zos_os390/support/ .

Message.MsgText: NULL_PROPERTY_VALUE_J2CA0085=J2CA0085I: Connector property {0} on resource {1} has a null value.
Message.Explanation: A connector property was not given a value, and it does not have a default. The set method is not called. This could be the cause of a later error.
Message.UserResponse: No user action is required.

Message.MsgText: UNABLE_TO_RETRIEVE_J2RA_J2CA0645=J2CA0645E: Unable to retrieve the J2C Resource Adapter from the ObjectName provided.
Message.Explanation: The command was unable to retrieve the J2C Resource Adapter from the ObjectName that was provided.
Message.UserResponse: Make sure that the ObjectName entered is the correct name for a J2C Resource Adapter. Correct ObjectName syntax can be retrieved by invoking the AdminConfig.list("J2CResourceAdapter") command.

Message.MsgText: CALLERPRINCIPAL_NOT_PROVIDED_J2CA0669=J2CA0669E: The resource adapter did not provide a CallerPrincipalCallback, an execution subject containing a single principal, or an empty execution subject.
Message.Explanation: The WorkManager could not establish the principal of the caller identity because the resource adapter did not supply an instance of a JASPIC CallerPrincipalCallback necessary for the WorkManager to determine the caller principal, nor did the setupSecurityContext method of the SecurityContext implementation return an execution subject containing either an empty principal set or a principal set containing exactly one principal.
Message.UserResponse: Contact the resource adapter vendor to determine why the inbound SecurityContext implementation does not satisfy the requirements necessary for the WorkManager to establish the principal of the caller identity.

Message.MsgText: TRANSACTION_SUPPORT_LEVEL_CHANGED_J2CA0237=J2CA0237I: Transaction support level has been changed from {0} to {1} that was returned by the resource adapter.
Message.Explanation: The resource adapter returned a level of transaction support whose ordinal value is equal to or less than the value specified in the metadata of the resource adapter. The JCA specification requires in such case the level of transaction support to be changed a value returned by the resource adapter.
Message.UserResponse: No user action is required.

Message.MsgText: BAD_RETURN_VALUE_FROM_ENLIST_J2CA0087=J2CA0087E: The transaction manager was unable to enlist resource {0} from DataSource {1}.
Message.Explanation: This message indicates a problem enlisting in a transaction. The resource might have already been enrolled in a transaction or the transaction might not have been in the correct state.
Message.UserResponse: Check that the business logic of the application is properly catching the exception created and that it contains the necessary recovery logic. Check log files for previous errors (specifically transaction errors) that might have caused the exception.

Message.MsgText: USING_DEFAULT_CMCONFIGDATA_J2CA0122=J2CA0122I: Resource reference {0} could not be located, so the following default values are used: {1}
Message.Explanation: An internal error might have occurred, but most likely a direct JNDI lookup was done on a connection factory or data source. Processing will continue using the default resource-ref values.
Message.UserResponse: There is no user action required.

Message.MsgText: SERVERS_RUNNING_DURING_UPDATE_J2CA0647=J2CA0647E: All servers under node {0} must be stopped while updating a Resource Adapter on that node.
Message.Explanation: All servers must be stopped on a node while updating Resource Adapters on the node.
Message.UserResponse: Stop all running servers within the node.

Message.MsgText: ACTIVATION_STATE_ACTIVE_J2CA0523=J2CA0523I: The Message Endpoint for ActivationSpec {0} and MDB Application {1} is activated.
Message.Explanation: The message endpoint exists, and it is enabled to handle incoming messages.
Message.UserResponse: There is no user action required.

Message.MsgText: UNEXPECTED_CONNECTION_EVENT_J2CA0034=J2CA0034E: An unexpected event was received from the Resource Adapter for resource {2}. Expected ConnectionEvent type {0} and received ConnectionEvent type {1}.
Message.Explanation: This is most likely an error with the specific resource adapter.
Message.UserResponse: Contact the resource adapter supplier.

Message.MsgText: OBJECT_DESERIALIZE_FAILED_J2CA0201=J2CA0201E: Object cannot be deserialized. The exception stack trace follows: {0}
Message.Explanation: This is an internal system error that is probably caused by a previous error.
Message.UserResponse: Examine any related messages to determine the cause of the problem. If there are no related messages, or they do not help resolve the problem, visit the IBM support site.

Message.MsgText: INVALID_OR_UNEXPECTED_SETTING_J2CA0067=J2CA0067W: Invalid {0} setting of {1}. Defaulting to {2} instead.
Message.Explanation: An internal error occurred. Using the default value.
Message.UserResponse: This is only a warning. If an error occurs later it may help in diagnosing the problem. Otherwise This can be ignored.

Message.MsgText: INVALID_CONTEXT_COMBINATION_J2CA0223=J2CA0223E: Work task is requested with both execution and work contexts.
Message.Explanation: Resource adapter must not submit a Work that implements WorkContextProvider along with a valid ExecutionContext.
Message.UserResponse: Decide which context to use and either do not submit a Work that implements WorkContextProvider or use a null value for the ExecutionContext parameter in WorkManager methods that take it as argument.

Message.MsgText: ASSPEC_CLASSNAME_NOTFOUND_J2CA0134=J2CA0134E: An ActivationSpec JavaBean class name not found for ResourceAdapter {0}.
Message.Explanation: This exception is unexpected. The cause is not immediately known.
Message.UserResponse: If the problem persists, additional information might be available if you search for the message ID on the following Web sites: WebSphere Application Server Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/was/support/ WebSphere Application Server for z/OS Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/zos_os390/support/ .

Message.MsgText: ALERT_SURGE_MODE_J2CA0513=J2CA0513W: Surge Mode Alert for ConnectionFactory or DataSource {0}. Surge mode has been exited.
Message.Explanation: Data sources and connection factories can be configured to limit the rate at which new connections are created based on the configuration thresholds. If the surge feature has been configured and this alert is disabled, this message indicates that you have exited the surge throttling mode whereby the connection creation rate is governed by the surge configuration parameters.
Message.UserResponse: If your connection factory or data source is spending excessive time in surge mode you might want to verify the configuration parameters or determine if there are other underlying causes.

Message.MsgText: DEACTIVATE_FAILED_J2CA0152=J2CA0152E: Deactivation of a Message Endpoint failed because the targeted ResourceAdapter, {0}, is not currently started or was not found. Deactivation key is: {1}
Message.Explanation: The given resource adapter could not be found or was not in a started state. The message endpoint could not be deactivated.
Message.UserResponse: Check that the resource adapter is configured correctly, has not been stopped, and that the MDB is mapped to use a valid resource adapter. Also, applications must be stopped before the resource adapter is stopped.

Message.MsgText: SHAREDPOOL_REMOVESHAREDCONNECTION_ERROR_J2CA1003=J2CA1003E: Failed to remove MCWrapper {0} from the shared pool.
Message.Explanation: The attempt to remove an MCWrapper failed, causing a potential problem in the shared pool.
Message.UserResponse: If the problem persists, additional information might be available if you search for the message ID on the following Web sites: WebSphere Application Server Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/was/support/ WebSphere Application Server for z/OS Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/zos_os390/support/ .

Message.MsgText: INVALID_CUSTOM_PROP_VALUE_J2CA0692=J2CA0692W: A value of {0} was specified for the {1} custom property defined for the resource with JNDI name of {2}. The value is not valid. The custom property is ignored.
Message.Explanation: A value that is not valid was provided for the custom property being defined. The desired behavior will not take effect.
Message.UserResponse: Verify that the value for the custom property being defined is valid.

Message.MsgText: UNEXPECTED_ERROR_OCCURED_GETTING_PROPERTY_J2CA0667=J2CA0667E: An unexpected error has occured while getting the value of the connection factory property {0}.
Message.Explanation: The attempt to get the value of the custom property failed.
Message.UserResponse: If the problem persists, additional information might be available if you search for the message ID on the following Web sites: WebSphere Application Server Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/was/support/ WebSphere Application Server for z/OS Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/zos_os390/support/ .

Message.MsgText: NO_SET_METHOD_EXCP_J2CA0035=J2CA0035E: Class {0}, used by resource {2} did not contain method set{1}. Processing halted.
Message.Explanation: The set method does not exist for this class; the connection manager expected this method to exist. The resource adapter requires this set method to be run to function properly, so the ManagedConnectionFactory is discarded. The class file for this ManagedConnectionFactory might be out of date, or there might be a miscommunication between WebSphere Systems Management and the connection manager.
Message.UserResponse: Check that the class files for this resource adapter are up to date.

Message.MsgText: RA_CREATION_FAILED_J2CA0043=J2CA0043E: An Exception occurred while trying to instantiate a ResourceAdapter JavaBean instance for the installed ResourceAdapter defined by key {0}. The exception is: {1}
Message.Explanation: The path for the resource adapter has not been configured correctly, or the resources.xml file (or deployment.xml file if you are using an embedded RAR file) is corrupted.
Message.UserResponse: Correct the path configuration for the resource adapter or repair the XML configuration file.

Message.MsgText: NULL_THREAD_POOL_MGR_J2CA0157=J2CA0157E: Unable to get the ThreadPoolMgr service.
Message.Explanation: This exception is unexpected. The cause is not immediately known.
Message.UserResponse: If the problem persists, additional information might be available if you search for the message ID on the following Web sites: WebSphere Application Server Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/was/support/ WebSphere Application Server for z/OS Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/zos_os390/support/ .

Message.MsgText: INVALID_USERNAME_PASSWORD_INBOUND_J2CA0674=J2CA0674E: The user name {0} or password provided by the PasswordValidationCallback is invalid.
Message.Explanation: The user name and password do not exist in the user registry of the realm that is configured for the security domain associated with the application.
Message.UserResponse: Configure the resource adapter and enterprise information system to use a valid user name and password.

Message.MsgText: VALIDATION_FAILED_INBOUND_J2CA0684=J2CA0684E: Unable to validate the user name {0} and password that is provided by the PasswordValidationCallback.
Message.Explanation: The WorkManager was not able to validate the user name and password that is provided by the PasswordValidationCallback because of a CustomRegistryException. This exception is caused by an invalid password or a problem with the user registry for that application realm.
Message.UserResponse: If the cause of the CustomRegistryException is an invalid password, configure the resource adapter or enterprise information system to use a valid user name and password combination. Otherwise resolve the problem with the user registry.

Message.MsgText: AS_ALIAS_NOT_VALID_J2CA0149=J2CA0149W: The contents of the AuthenticationAlias assigned to the ActivationSpec {0} used by MDB {1} are invalid. The UserName and/or the Password were either null or blank. The AuthenticationAlias was: {2}, its UserName was: {3}, and its Password was: {4}
Message.Explanation: The user name, password, or both assigned to the authentication alias that is being used by the MDB is not valid.
Message.UserResponse: Check that the authentication alias has been properly configured and that it is assigned to either the activation specification configuration or specified as part of the MDB deployment step.

Message.MsgText: ALERT_SURGE_MODE_J2CA0503=J2CA0503W: Surge Mode Alert for ConnectionFactory or DataSource {0}. Surge mode has been entered.
Message.Explanation: Data sources and connection factories can be configured to limit the rate at which new connections are created based on configuration thresholds. If the surge feature has been configured and this alert is enabled, this message indicates that you have entered the surge throttling mode, and the connection creation rate is governed by the surge configuration parameters.
Message.UserResponse: If your connection factory or data source is spending excessive time in surge mode, you might want to verify the configuration parameters or investigate for other underlying causes.

Message.MsgText: XML_FILE_READ_J2CA0117=J2CA0117I: Properties file {0} with root element {1} was successfully read.
Message.Explanation: This is an informational message.
Message.UserResponse: There is no user action required.

Message.MsgText: NULL_PROPERTY_VALUE_J2CA0050=J2CA0050W: Setting of the Connector property {0} on class {1} for resource {2} will be skipped. Property has a null value.
Message.Explanation: A connector property was not given a value, nor does it have a default. The set method is not called. This could be the root cause of a later error.
Message.UserResponse: There is no user action required.

Message.MsgText: NO_ACTIVATION_SPEC_PROP_J2CA0300=J2CA0300I: ActivationSpec {0} has no configuration properties. The ActivationSpec class is {1} for ResourceAdapter {2}. This may have undesirable effects.
Message.Explanation: No configuration properties were supplied for the activation specification. This might be normal, but if a value is required then omitting a value could cause a failure.
Message.UserResponse: Supply a value if one is required.

Message.MsgText: CONN_FAILOVER_FAILURE_TO_CONNECT_TO_RESOURCE_J2CA0683=J2CA0683E: Connection management failed to connect to the resource with a JNDI name of {0}. Resource fail-over is disabled.
Message.Explanation: Connection management failed to connect to the specified resource.
Message.UserResponse: Verify that the JNDI name provided for the resource in question is valid. Verify that the resource is operational. If connection fail-over has been configured for a resource adapter, verify that the version of the resource adapter implements the required infrastructure.

Message.MsgText: RA_NOT_STARTED_J2CA0153=J2CA0153E: The requested ResourceAdapter {0} is not in a started state.
Message.Explanation: The requested resource adapter was found, but it was not in a started state. This might be because it was stopped by an MBean request, the application server might be shutting down, or the resource adapter might be embedded within an application that has stopped. A resource adapter is not usable in a stopped state.
Message.UserResponse: Check that the resource adapter is started.

Message.MsgText: ACTIVATE_FAILED_J2CA0151=J2CA0151E: Activation of Message Endpoint for application {0} failed because the targeted ResourceAdapter, {1}, is not currently started.
Message.Explanation: The given resource adapter could not be found or was not in a started state, so the message endpoint could not be activated.
Message.UserResponse: Check that the resource adapter is configured correctly, has not been stopped, and that the MDB is mapped to use a valid resource adapter.

Message.MsgText: ERROR_CREATING_XA_RESOURCE_J2CA0061=J2CA0061W: Error creating XA Connection and Resource {0}
Message.Explanation: An error occurred recreating an XA resource. The resource could not be recovered.
Message.UserResponse: Check for other related messages that can further explain the problem.

Message.MsgText: FAILED_MANAGED_CONNECTION_J2CA0020=J2CA0020E: The Connection Pool Manager could not allocate a Managed Connection: {0}.
Message.Explanation: The pool manager created an exception when attempting to allocate a managed connection. The exception text might provide additional information for determining the problem.
Message.UserResponse: If there are no user controlled indications, the message might be due to an internal error in the connection manager processing. Collect diagnostic data and visit the IBM support site for more information.

Message.MsgText: CREATE_CONNECTOR_PROPERTIES_EXCP_J2CA0003=J2CA0003E: An exception occurred while trying to read the Connection Factory Properties for {0} : {1}.
Message.Explanation: There is a problem with the Systems Management configuration of the connection factory. The properties do exist for the connection factory, but they are not in the right format to read and process.
Message.UserResponse: If the problem persists, additional information might be available if you search for the message ID on the following Web sites: WebSphere Application Server Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/was/support/ WebSphere Application Server for z/OS Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/zos_os390/support/ .

Message.MsgText: ACTIVATION_GETACTIVATIONPROPS_FAILED_J2CA0521=J2CA0521E: Acquiring Message Endpoint properties for ActivationSpec {0} and MDB Application {1} failed because the Message Endpoint is currently stopped.
Message.Explanation: Message endpoints that are stopped do not have JMS properties at run time.
Message.UserResponse: Check that the message endpoint is not stopped before invoking the getActivationProperties() method.

Message.MsgText: MISSING_AUTH_DATA_ENTRY_J2CA0130=J2CA0130I: {0} [{1}] has Component-managed Authentication Alias [{2}] but no corresponding J2C Authentication Data Entry is defined in security.xml. This may have undesirable effects.
Message.Explanation: A J2C authentication data entry corresponding to the component-managed authentication alias was expected but not found.
Message.UserResponse: Define a J2C Authentication data entry under Security > JAAS configuration in the administrative console, and choose this entry for the component-managed authentication alias on the connection factory or the data source configuration.

Message.MsgText: NULL_COMPONENT_METADATA_ACCESSOR_EXCP_J2CA0041=J2CA0041E: The ComponentMetaData instance was null in method {0}.
Message.Explanation: This exception is unexpected. The cause is not immediately known.
Message.UserResponse: If the problem persists, additional information might be available if you search for the message ID on the following Web sites: WebSphere Application Server Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/was/support/ WebSphere Application Server for z/OS Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/zos_os390/support/ .

Message.MsgText: RAR_OLD_VERSION_J2CA0637=J2CA0637I: The version of the Resource Adapter you are updating from is {0}
Message.Explanation: The version of the Resource Adapter you are updating from is specified in the message. This is an informational message only.
Message.UserResponse: None

Message.MsgText: FAILED_TO_VALIDATE_AS_J2CA0137=J2CA0137E: The ActivationSpec validate() method failed with an InvalidPropertyException. The ActivationSpec is {0}, which belongs to the installed ResourceAdapter {1} and is associated with the MDB application {2}. See the following list of failed properties along with their values: {3}. The exception is: {4}
Message.Explanation: The resource adapter has rejected the activation specification as it is currently configured.
Message.UserResponse: See the exception text from the resource adapter for more details.

Message.MsgText: FAILED_TO_GET_TRANSACTION_STATUS_J2CA0064=J2CA0064E: Failed to get transaction status {0}
Message.Explanation: This is an internal error.
Message.UserResponse: If the problem persists, additional information might be available if you search for the message ID on the following Web sites: WebSphere Application Server Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/was/support/ WebSphere Application Server for z/OS Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/zos_os390/support/ .

Message.MsgText: AS_BIND_FAILED_J2CA0158=J2CA0158E: Failed to bind an Activation Specification to the namespace with JNDI name {0}. The associated Resource Adapter key is {1}.
Message.Explanation: This exception is unexpected. The cause is not immediately known.
Message.UserResponse: If the problem persists, additional information might be available if you search for the message ID on the following Web sites: WebSphere Application Server Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/was/support/ WebSphere Application Server for z/OS Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/zos_os390/support/ .

Message.MsgText: INVALID_RESOURCE_ADAPTER_ID_J2CA0697=J2CA0697E: The resource adapter could not be updated because the specified target object identifier {0} does not exist.
Message.Explanation: The object identifier of an existing resource adapter must be specified for the update operation.
Message.UserResponse: Verify the object identifier of the target resource adapter, and retry the update operation.

Message.MsgText: ACTION_NOTIFICATION_FAILURE_TO_CONNECT_TO_RESOURCE_J2CA0687=J2CA0687E: Connection management failed to connect to the resource with a JNDI name of {0}. Failure notification action support is disabled.
Message.Explanation: Connection management failed to connect to the specified resource.
Message.UserResponse: Verify that the JNDI name provided for the resource in question is valid. If connection fail-over and failure notification action support have been configured for a resource adapter, verify that the version of the resource adapter implements the required infrastructure.

Message.MsgText: ENGLISH_ONLY_MESSAGE_J2CA0093=J2CA0093W: This is an English only message: {0}
Message.Explanation: Message was not translated.
Message.UserResponse: See the message text for details.

Message.MsgText: ENGLISH_ONLY_MESSAGE_J2CA0092=J2CA0092E: This is an English only message: {0}.
Message.Explanation: Message was not translated.
Message.UserResponse: See the message text for details.

Message.MsgText: ENGLISH_ONLY_MESSAGE_J2CA0090=J2CA0090I: This is an English only message: {0}
Message.Explanation: The message was not translated.
Message.UserResponse: See the message text for details.

Message.MsgText: INVALID_TRANSACTION_SUPPORT_LEVEL_J2CA0236=J2CA0236E: The resource adapter returned a runtime level of transaction support whose value is greater than that specified in the metadata of the resource adapter. The transaction support level has not been changed. The metadata value is {0}, the runtime value is {1}.
Message.Explanation: The JCA specification requires that a resource adapter must always return a level of transaction support whose ordinal value is equal to or less than the value specified in the metadata of the resource adapter.
Message.UserResponse: To override the transaction level value specified in the metadata of the resource adapter, use a transaction level support value that is equal to or less than the metadata value.

Message.MsgText: CREATE_MANAGED_CONNECTION_FACTORY_DETAILS_EXCP_J2CA0009=J2CA0009E: An exception occurred while trying to instantiate the ManagedConnectionFactory class {0} used by resource {2} : {1}.
Message.Explanation: There was an exception while attempting to create a ManagedConnectionFactory object. There are several possible reasons for this problem. The connection manager (1) could not find the appropriate class for the ManagedConnectionFactory using the context class loader, (2) could not create a TraceWriter object for the ManagedConnectionFactory, or (3) could not create the ConnectionManager object for the ManagedConnectionFactory. Any of these problems could also be related to an XML definition for the resource adapter that is not valid.
Message.UserResponse: If the problem persists, additional information might be available if you search for the message ID on the following Web sites: WebSphere Application Server Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/was/support/ WebSphere Application Server for z/OS Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/zos_os390/support/ .

Message.MsgText: ALERT_THREAD_CONN_LIMIT_J2CA0510=J2CA0510W: Thread Connection Limit Alert for ConnectionFactory or DataSource {0}. The number of connections in use by this thread of execution is {1}. This has exceeded the configured threshold of {2}. If callstack capture is enabled the callstack at the time the connection was requested will be provided in the alert contents.
Message.Explanation: Any single requesting thread which ties up multiple connections can unexpectedly contribute to rapid pool starvation or inefficient use of connection resources. This alert can help detect such situations and provide information that will help with pinpointing the problem.
Message.UserResponse: For more information consult the documentation.

Message.MsgText: ALERT_LTC_NESTING_J2CA0509=J2CA0509W: LTC Nesting Level Alert for ConnectionFactory or DataSource {0}. The depth of Local Transaction Containment Nesting for this request is {1}. This has exceeded the configured threshold of {2}. If callstack capture is enabled the callstack at the time the connection was requested will be provided in the alert contents.
Message.Explanation: The nesting of an LTC that is not expected can have side effects of tying up more connections than expected. This alert might help in determining the problem.
Message.UserResponse: Refer to the error text and support documentation for more information.

Message.MsgText: INVALID_COPMP_ALIAS_J2CA0215=J2CA0215W: Component-managed authentication alias {0} for ConnectionFactory or DataSource {1} is invalid. It may be necessary to re-start the server for previous configuration changes to take effect.
Message.Explanation: If the connection factory had been created by a JNDI lookup, previous configuration changes do not take effect until the next server restart.
Message.UserResponse: Check the accuracy of the component-managed authentication alias configured on the connection factory or data source. Re-start the server.

Message.MsgText: XA_RESOURCE_ADAPTER_OPERATION_EXCP_J2CA0028=J2CA0028E: An exception occurred while invoking {0} on an XA Resource Adapter from DataSource {2} : {1}.
Message.Explanation: There was a problem processing the given method. The processing within the method did not complete successfully.
Message.UserResponse: Check that the business logic of the application is properly catching the exception that was created and that it contains the necessary recovery logic. Also check the log files for earlier errors that caused the exception.

Message.MsgText: FILE_UNAVAILABLE_FOR_UPDATE_J2CA0648=J2CA0648E: The RAR file {0} does not exist or cannot be read.
Message.Explanation: The RAR file either does not exist or is not readable.
Message.UserResponse: Check the path to the RAR file and make sure that there are no other processes accessing it.

Message.MsgText: RA_STOP_XARECOVERY_FAILED_J2CA0204=J2CA0204W: The attempt to stop ResourceAdapter failed during XARecovery cleanup and will be ignored. It was due to the following exception: {0}
Message.Explanation: An exception occurred while attempting to stop a resource adapter.
Message.UserResponse: Take appropriate action based on the exception text.

Message.MsgText: CREATE_RA_MISC_PROPERTIES_EXCP_J2CA0101=J2CA0101E: Unable to obtain RA miscellaneous configuration information for J2CConnectionFactory {0} : {1}
Message.Explanation: The RA miscellaneous configuration object could not be read.
Message.UserResponse: See the FFDC logs for more information on the error.

Message.MsgText: BUCKET_CF_SPECIFIC_J2CA0124=J2CA0124I: Pool properties for {1} were read from {0}.
Message.Explanation: This is an informational message.
Message.UserResponse: There is no user action required.

Message.MsgText: TRANSACTION_FAILED_J2CA0094=J2CA0094E: The transaction this operation is part of has failed. Cancelling the operation. Throwing exception {0}
Message.Explanation: The transaction for this operation has failed, possibly due to a transaction timeout.
Message.UserResponse: See messages from the transaction service for more information.

Message.MsgText: INCOMPATIBLE_PROPERTY_TYPE_J2CA0207=J2CA0207W: A resource adapter artifact has property {0} whose value {2} is incompatible with its type {1}.
Message.Explanation: A connection factory, activation spec or admin object has a resource property which is not valid. The value will remain unset.
Message.UserResponse: Correct the resource property so the value is consistent with its data type.

Message.MsgText: NO_CONNECTOR_NAME_EXCP_J2CA0011=J2CA0011E: There is no connector name in the Reference object for method {0}.
Message.Explanation: There is a problem with the Reference object that was initially stored in the JNDI name space.
Message.UserResponse: If the problem persists, additional information might be available if you search for the message ID on the following Web sites: WebSphere Application Server Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/was/support/ WebSphere Application Server for z/OS Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/zos_os390/support/ .

Message.MsgText: ERROR_CREATING_OBJECTNAMES_J2CA0110=J2CA0110W: A JMException was thrown when creating ObjectNames for {0} the exception is {1}.
Message.Explanation: An internal error occurred. The ObjectNames that were used on the lookup were not created.
Message.UserResponse: If the problem persists, additional information might be available if you search for the message ID on the following Web sites: WebSphere Application Server Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/was/support/ WebSphere Application Server for z/OS Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/zos_os390/support/ .

Message.MsgText: MBEAN_NOT_FOUND_J2CA0108=J2CA0108E: the parent MBean for {1} could not be found, the identifier used to find the MBean is {0}.
Message.Explanation: An internal error has occurred. The parent MBean should be created when the connection factory or data source is bound into the namespace.
Message.UserResponse: Collect diagnostic data and visit the IBM support web site for more information.

Message.MsgText: NONNODE_UPDATE_SUCCESSFUL_J2CA0654=J2CA0654I: The update of {0} to RAR file {1} was successful. The resource adapter configuration was updated, but not the binaries. The configuration was automatically saved.
Message.Explanation: When updating a resource adapter at a scope other than node scope, only a configuration update is possible.
Message.UserResponse: To update the binaries, perform an update on the node scoped resource adapter that the specified resource adapter is a copy of, if it has not been updated already.

Message.MsgText: XA_END_EXCP_J2CA0024=J2CA0024E: Method {0}, within transaction branch ID {1} of resource pool {4}, caught {2} and threw a {3}.
Message.Explanation: There was a problem processing the given method. The interface defines specific exceptions that can be created, so the exception that was caught was mapped to the exception that was created. The processing within the method did not complete successfully.
Message.UserResponse: Check that the business logic of the application is properly catching the exception that was created and that it contains the necessary recovery logic. Also check the log files for earlier errors that caused the exception.

Message.MsgText: XML_PARSING_ERROR_J2CA0125=J2CA0125W: Error parsing XML document {0}.
Message.Explanation: The XML document is not formed correctly.
Message.UserResponse: See the XML document for possible errors.

Message.MsgText: DIRECT_LOOKUP_OF_RESOURCE_J2CA0294=J2CA0294W: Direct JNDI lookup of resource {0}. The following default values are used: {1}
Message.Explanation: Avoid using the fully qualified names of resources when looking up resources through Java Naming Directory Interface (JNDI). The Java EE programming model recommends the use of resource references and the local JNDI java:comp/env context.
Message.UserResponse: Modify the application to use the preferred Java EE programming model with resource references and the local JNDI java:comp/env context.

Message.MsgText: XA_OPERATION_NOT_SUPPORTED_J2CA0023=J2CA0023E: A two phase XA operation, {0}, was invoked. This Resource Adapter from DataSource {1} does not support two phase processing.
Message.Explanation: There was an attempt made to invoke an XA operation on a resource adapter that only supports local transactions. A local transaction resource adapter might have been included within the context of an XA transaction, along with other XA capable resources.
Message.UserResponse: Modify the business logic to separate the resource usage into separate transactions.

Message.MsgText: FAILED_TO_OBTAIN_XAResource_J2CA0078=J2CA0078E: An exception was caught while trying to obtain a javax.transaction.xa.XAResource from a ManagedConnection on DataSource {1}. The exception is: {0}
Message.Explanation: The connection manager was unable to obtain a XAResource from the resource adapter. This indicates a problem with the resource adapter.
Message.UserResponse: Look for error messages from the resource adapter to identify the problem.

Message.MsgText: BAD_REFERENCE_PARAMETER_EXCP_J2CA0010=J2CA0010E: Parameter in method {0} is not of type Reference: {1}.
Message.Explanation: The getObjectInstance method is invoked by the JNDI lookup processing of the resource. The implementation of the JNDI lookup should be passing in a valid Reference object for the desired resource. Either the name service is passing in a bad object or the Reference object was created incorrectly.
Message.UserResponse: If the problem persists, additional information might be available if you search for the message ID on the following Web sites: WebSphere Application Server Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/was/support/ WebSphere Application Server for z/OS Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/zos_os390/support/ .

Message.MsgText: NO_ACCESS_TO_RA_COPY_J2CA0662=J2CA0662E: There are copies of resource adapter {0} that the command executor does not have configurator access to at the following scopes: {1}. Updating the resource adapter is not recommended.
Message.Explanation: The command executor does not have configurator privilege for a copy of the resource adapter at the given scope. Copies of a Resource Adapter depend on the given Resource Adapter's binary files. They must all be updated, but they cannot be updated without the adequate privileges.
Message.UserResponse: Run the command with a user ID that has configurator access privileges to the resource adapter(s) at the scopes that are listed.

Message.MsgText: DO_START_FAILED_J2CA0143=J2CA0143E: Embedded ResourceAdapter initialization failed due to Exception: {0}
Message.Explanation: This exception is unexpected. The cause is not immediately known.
Message.UserResponse: If the problem persists, additional information might be available if you search for the message ID on the following Web sites: WebSphere Application Server Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/was/support/ WebSphere Application Server for z/OS Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/zos_os390/support/ .

Message.MsgText: ALERT_CONN_LOW_EFF_J2CA0501=J2CA0501W: Connection Low Efficiency Alert for ConnectionFactory or DataSoure {0}. The usage efficiency for a connection is {1} which is below the configured alert threshold of {2} percent efficiency. If callstack capture is enabled, the callstack at the time the connection was requested will be provided in the alert contents.
Message.Explanation: You have configured the monitoring of individual connections for low usage efficiency. For connections that are not shared, efficiency is measured from the time the connection is received to the time it is released. For connections that are sharable, efficiency is measured from the time it is received to the time that the sharing boundary ends, which is typically the end of a transaction or component method. The usage efficiency is the amount of time that the connection is used to interact with the backend, divided by the total amount of time the connection has been held. It is expressed as a percentage.
Message.UserResponse: If the efficiency is lower than expected, examine the application for possible causes.

Message.MsgText: HA_ENABLED_MISMATCH_J2CA0304=J2CA0304W: Conflicting high availability support was found for resource adapter {0}. The resource adapter was configured to have high availability support enabled, but the resource adapter has a conflicting property value. The resource adapter cannot register with the high availability manager.
Message.Explanation: The resource adapter is configured to be highly available, but the resource adapter implementation class indicates that the resource adapter does not support high availability.
Message.UserResponse: Ensure that high availability is enabled for this resource adapter. To enable high availability either select Register this resource adapter with the high availability manager on the Resource adapter page of the administrator console, or include the EnableHASupport attribute on the J2CResourceAdapter configuration object in the wsadmin tool.

Message.MsgText: DUPLICATE_CONNECTOR_PROPERTY_J2CA0308=J2CA0308W: Duplicate connector property not added. {0}.
Message.Explanation: An attempt was made to add a duplicate connector property. The property was not added.
Message.UserResponse: A custom property of a connection factory or data source was specified, but the property already existed. This could be a symptom of a hand-modified resources.xml document.

Message.MsgText: EXTRA_APP_ACCESS_J2CA0283=J2CA0283E: Attempt to access embedded Resource Adapter of another application via ConnectionFactory {0}.
Message.Explanation: An application attempted to lookup a connection factory that is associated with an embedded resource adapter for another application.
Message.UserResponse: The application should use a connection factory that is associated with its own resource adapter or use a connection factory that is associated with a stand-alone resource adapter.

Message.MsgText: ACTIVATION_STATE_PARTIALLY_ACTIVE_J2CA0530=J2CA0530I: The Message Endpoint for ActivationSpec {0} and MDB Application {1} is partially activated but has been disabled from handling incoming messages.
Message.Explanation: The message endpoint exists, but has been disabled from handling incoming messages by setting the custom property WAS_EndpointInitialState to INACTIVE.
Message.UserResponse: Activate the endpoint by using the resume method on the J2CMessageEndpoint MBean.

Message.MsgText: CROSS_COMPONENT_HANDLE_USE_J2CA0166=J2CA0166W: An attempt to concurrently use a connection handle within different application server components has been detected. The connection handle is: {0}.
Message.Explanation: It is a programming model violation to use a connection handle in a component instance that is different from the component instance that first created the connection. Components consist of servlets, JSPs, EJBs, MDBs, and asynchronous Beans.
Message.UserResponse: Do not make the connection handle available to any component instance that did not implement the getConnection call.

Message.MsgText: INTERUPTED_EXCEPTION_J2CA0091=J2CA0091E: An InterruptedException occurred on the Garbage Collector thread.
Message.Explanation: An InterruptedException occurred on the thread for the garbage collector. J2C processing will continue, but unused and aged connections will not be collected.
Message.UserResponse: If the problem persists, additional information might be available if you search for the message ID on the following Web sites: WebSphere Application Server Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/was/support/ WebSphere Application Server for z/OS Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/zos_os390/support/ .

Message.MsgText: MAX_NUM_RESERVE_POOLS_EXCEEDED_J2CA1009=J2CA1009E: The number of reserve pools defined by numberOfPoolReserves is {0}. The maximum number of reserve pools allowed is {1}.
Message.Explanation: The supplied number of reserve pools to generate exceeds the maximum number allowed.
Message.UserResponse: Change the value of numberOfPoolReserves to be less than or equal to the maximum number of reserve pools allowed.

Message.MsgText: DUPLICATE_USERNAME_PASSWORD_CONNECTOR_PROPERTY_J2CA0103=J2CA0103I: Duplicate connector property not added. {0}
Message.Explanation: An attempt was made to add a duplicate connector property. The property was not added.
Message.UserResponse: A custom property of a connection factory or data source specified a user name or password, but a component-managed authentication alias was also specified. The alias takes precedence over the custom properties. This error might also be the result of a hand-modified resources.xml document.

Message.MsgText: UNREG_AS_FAILED_J2CA0141=J2CA0141W: Failed to de-register the Activation Specification from the Transaction Service. Caught exception {0}.
Message.Explanation: The transaction service was unable to unregister an activation specification at this time. This might be due to outstanding transactional work involving this activation specification. This might be a transient error.
Message.UserResponse: Restarting the server should clear up any outstanding transactions. If the error persists, visit the IBM support web site.

Message.MsgText: CLASS_NOT_FOUND_INVALID_RAR_J2CA0656=J2CA0656E: A ClassNotFoundException was caught during command execution. {0} listed in the ra.xml was {1}, but that class could not be found in {2}.
Message.Explanation: The ra.xml defined a class to be loaded as a Resource Adapter, Connection Factory, Activation Specification or Admin Object, but the class could not be loaded from the rar file. This likely means the RAR file is corrupt or not valid.
Message.UserResponse: Confirm that the RAR file is not corrupted, then contact your Resource Adapter vendor to make sure that the Resource Adapter provided is valid.

Message.MsgText: UNABLE_TO_CHANGE_PROPERTY_J2CA0169=J2CA0169E: Unable to change the property {0} on DataSource or ConnectionFactory {1}.
Message.Explanation: The connection manager was unable to make the requested change to the configuration variable at this time.
Message.UserResponse: Attempt to change the configuration variable again.

Message.MsgText: DEACTIVATION_INFO_NOT_FOUND_J2CA0100=J2CA0100E: The information object needed to deactivate the endpoint was not found for deactivationKey {0}. Throwing exception {1}
Message.Explanation: This exception is unexpected. The cause is not immediately known.
Message.UserResponse: If the problem persists, additional information might be available if you search for the message ID on the following Web sites: WebSphere Application Server Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/was/support/ WebSphere Application Server for z/OS Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/zos_os390/support/ .

Message.MsgText: CONNECTIONFACTORY_IMPLEMENTATION_REMOVED_J2CA0640=J2CA0640I: The new RAR file is not compatible with the Resource Adapter. A ManagedConnectionFactory implementation class {2} was removed, and there is a configured connection factory that uses the removed type. ConnectionFactory name: {0}, JNDI Name: {1}.
Message.Explanation: The new RAR file has removed a ManagedConnectionFactory implementation, and the Resource Adapter currently has at least one configured factory that makes use of the removed implementation. This makes the Resource Adapter and RAR incompatible for update.
Message.UserResponse: To update to the new version of the Resource Adapter, delete the connection factories that use the implementation class that was removed. The configuration for these factories will be lost.

Message.MsgText: FAILED_CONNECTION_RELEASE_J2CA0022=J2CA0022I: An exception occurred while trying to cleanup and release the Managed Connection from resource {1} for a failed getConnection from the Managed Connection {0}. This second error was absorbed and the original error re-thrown.
Message.Explanation: There was a problem attempting to clean records from a failed getConnection attempt. This message is informational and should be combined with other related messages for proper problem determination.
Message.UserResponse: Examine the other related messages for explanations and user responses.

Message.MsgText: MALFORMED_PROPERTY_NAME_J2CA0664=J2CA0664E: The property name argument passed to the managed bean getProperty operation is empty or malformed.
Message.Explanation: A empty or malformed property name was used as the argument for the managed bean getProperty operation.
Message.UserResponse: Provide a non-empty, valid string as input for the managed bean getProperty operation.

Message.MsgText: UNSUPPORTED_CONTEXTS_FOUND_J2CA0225=J2CA0225E: WorkContext {0} is not supported.
Message.Explanation: The WorkContext is not supported by the application server.
Message.UserResponse: Do not use unsupported WorkContext when submitting a Work the implements WorkContextProvider.

Message.MsgText: ATTEMPT_TO_VALIDATE_MC_CONNECTIONS_J2CA0285=J2CA0285W: Method {0} caught an exception during validating managed connections for resource {3}, throwing {2}. Original exception: {1}
Message.Explanation: A call to the method getInvalidConnections() returned a resource exception.
Message.UserResponse: Visit the support web site for the provider of the resource adapter.

Message.MsgText: ENLIST_OPTION_USED_J2CA0053=J2CA0053W: Enlist option used is {0}. This differs from the desired option of {1} for resource {2}.
Message.Explanation: The resource adapter does not support the specified TransactionResourceRegistration setting. The J2C Runtime environment is using the default value.
Message.UserResponse: There is no user action required.

Message.MsgText: CONN_FAILOVER_RESOURCE_AVAILABLE_J2CA0682=J2CA0682I: The configured resource with a JNDI name of {0} is available to process new requests for the resource with a JNDI name of {1}.
Message.Explanation: The configured primary or alternate resource with the specified JNDI name is now available to process new requests.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: CREATE_MBEAN_PROPS_EXC_J2CA0120=J2CA0120W: An exception occurred when trying to read J2C MBean properties from the referenceable object {0}.
Message.Explanation: An internal error occurred, but it is not terminal. The connection factory or the data source will work correctly. An MBean might not be created for this object, and if one is it might contain bad data. PMI data might also not be able to link to the MBean.
Message.UserResponse: If the problem persists, additional information might be available if you search for the message ID on the following Web sites: WebSphere Application Server Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/was/support/ WebSphere Application Server for z/OS Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/zos_os390/support/ .

Message.MsgText: ALERT_CLAIM_VICTIM_J2CA0507=J2CA0507W: Claim Victim Alert for ConnectionFactory or DataSource {0}. The percentage of victim connections claimed over approximately the last {1} minutes has exceeded your configured threshold of {2} percent.
Message.Explanation: When a connection factory or data source has reached the maxConnection limit and a request comes in for a new connection, and it has connections available in its free pool that do not match the necessary criteria of the request, one of these connections will be destroyed, which is called the victim, so that a new connection can be created. This alert notifies you if the rate at which this is occurring exceeds the threshold that is configured.
Message.UserResponse: The excessive claiming of connections is detrimental to performance, and it might indicate a problem with how the application is using connections. In some usage scenarios this might be normal.

Message.MsgText: MISSING_THREAD_POOL_J2CA0289=J2CA0289W: Thread pool {0} has not been defined in the server configuration or is not configured correctly.
Message.Explanation: The thread pool that was specified for the resource adapter must first be created or configured correctly using system administration before it can be used by a resource adapter.
Message.UserResponse: Create the missing thread pool or fix the configuration for the thread pool.

Message.MsgText: DEST_LOOKUP_FAILED_REQUIRED_J2CA0164=J2CA0164E: The lookup of the Destination with JNDI Name {0} failed. The Destination is required by the Activation Specification. The lookup failed due to exception {1}.
Message.Explanation: The JNDI lookup of the destination failed. This could be caused by one of the following conditions: (1) the destination referred to by the specified JNDI name has not been configured, (2) the JNDI name is not correct, or (3) some other problem exists that is indicated by the exception.
Message.UserResponse: Check that the destination had been configured for the resource adapter that is in use. The destination can be configured as part of the activation specification configuration or during the MDB step during application deployment. Ensure that the JNDI name that is specified matches the name that is specified when creating the destination administered object on the resource adapter.

Message.MsgText: REALM_IS_NOT_TRUSTED_J2CA0685=J2CA0685E: An authenticated JAAS Subject from an untrusted realm {0}, was passed to the application server by the resource adapter.
Message.Explanation: The JAAS Subject that was passed in by the resource adapter does not belong to the application realm nor to a realm that is trusted by the application server.
Message.UserResponse: Add the realm to the list of realms trusted by the application server, or modify the resource adapter configuration or source code to pass in a subject that belongs to the application realm or a trusted realm.

Message.MsgText: ILLEGAL_ARGUMENT_EXCEPTION_J2CA0080=J2CA0080E: Method {0} has detected an internal illegal argument and is throwing an IllegalArgumentException. The exception is: {1}
Message.Explanation: The connection manager has detected an internal error.
Message.UserResponse: If the problem persists, additional information might be available if you search for the message ID on the following Web sites: WebSphere Application Server Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/was/support/ WebSphere Application Server for z/OS Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/zos_os390/support/ .

Message.MsgText: NO_VALID_TRANSACTION_CONTEXT_J2CA0040=J2CA0040E: No valid transaction context was found on the thread for method {0} with coordinator {1} using resources from DataSource {2}.
Message.Explanation: There was an internal error in the connection manager processing. A valid transaction context is required for the given operation, but it was not found.
Message.UserResponse: If the problem persists, additional information might be available if you search for the message ID on the following Web sites: WebSphere Application Server Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/was/support/ WebSphere Application Server for z/OS Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/zos_os390/support/ .

Message.MsgText: CREATE_CONNECTOR_POOL_PROPERTIES_EXCP_J2CA0005=J2CA0005E: An exception occurred while trying to read the Connection Pooling Properties for {0} from the namespace: {1}.
Message.Explanation: There is a problem with the Systems Management configuration of the connection factory. The properties for connection pooling do exist for the connection factory, but they are not in the right format to read and process.
Message.UserResponse: If the problem persists, additional information might be available if you search for the message ID on the following Web sites: WebSphere Application Server Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/was/support/ WebSphere Application Server for z/OS Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/zos_os390/support/ .

Message.MsgText: CWTE_NORMAL_J2CA1010=J2CA1010E: Connection not available; timed out waiting for {0} seconds.
Message.Explanation: This occurrs when a connection can not be obtained to a data source.
Message.UserResponse: No user action required.

Message.MsgText: ACTIVATION_STATE_STOPPED_J2CA0525=J2CA0525I: The Message Endpoint for ActivationSpec {0} and MDB Application {1} is stopped and its MBean is unusable.
Message.Explanation: Message endpoints stop, or expire, when their host applications or resource adapters stop. Once a message endpoint has stopped, getStatus() is the only method supported by its MBean; all other methods will throw an IllegalStateException.
Message.UserResponse: Restart the application hosting the message endpoint and obtain a new MBean reference in order to control the message endpoint.

Message.MsgText: ERROR_SETTING_TRACEWRITER_J2CA0118=J2CA0118W: An exception occurred when setting the trace writer on the ManagedConectionFactory. The MCF used was {0}. The exception was {1}.
Message.Explanation: The trace writer was not able to be set on the MCF. You will not see any specific trace entries for the resource adapter, but tracing for the application server will work if it is enabled.
Message.UserResponse: Check that there are no other exceptions in the FFDC logs. The other exceptions might indicate a problem with the ManagedConnectionFactory or in getting the correct PrintWriter. If there are no other exceptions, visit the support web site for the resource adapter.

Message.MsgText: METHOD_EXCEPTION_J2CA0154=J2CA0154E: The method {0} on class {1} returned the following exception: {2}
Message.Explanation: This exception is unexpected. The cause is not immediately known.
Message.UserResponse: If the problem persists, additional information might be available if you search for the message ID on the following Web sites: WebSphere Application Server Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/was/support/ WebSphere Application Server for z/OS Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/zos_os390/support/ .

Message.MsgText: BEAN_VALIDATION_DESCRIPTOR_UNACCESSIBLE_J2CA1005=J2CA1005E: An exception occurred while trying to access the Bean Validation descriptor file {0} : {1}.
Message.Explanation: The validation.xml file exists, but is unaccessible. The file may be unaccessaible due to insufficient read access priviledge on the file system, the file path is a directory, or the thread lacks permission to read the file.
Message.UserResponse: Check the FFDC logs. If the file lacks read access priviledge on the file system, add the priviledge to the file. CMSG0002

Message.MsgText: FILETRANSFERSERVER_NOT_AVAILABLE_J2CA650=J2CA0650E: The FileTransferServer mbean was unavailable, unable to proceed with update.
Message.Explanation: The FileTransferServer mbean was not able to be found, so the RAR file could not be sent, and the update process cannot continue.
Message.UserResponse: Check the FFDC logs and System.err logs within the {PROFILE_HOME}/logs directory to see if there are any errors during server startup.

Message.MsgText: MISSING_OR_UNRECOGNIZED_ROOT_ELEMENT_J2CA0116=J2CA0116W: The root element {1} of XML document {0} is not as expected.
Message.Explanation: A properties file was not coded correctly.
Message.UserResponse: Check that the root element of the XML document is correct.

Message.MsgText: TRANSACTION_REQUIRED_J2CA0076=J2CA0076E: An active transaction is required for the method {0}.
Message.Explanation: Processing requires the presence of a transaction in order to run the current method. The most common cause of a missing transaction context is that the transaction timed out.
Message.UserResponse: If the problem persists, additional information might be available if you search for the message ID on the following Web sites: WebSphere Application Server Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/was/support/ WebSphere Application Server for z/OS Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/zos_os390/support/ .

Message.MsgText: FAILED_TO_ENLIST_CONNECTION_J2CA0293=J2CA0293E: The Connection Manager lazyEnlist() method requires a non-null ManagedConnection parameter for resource {0}.
Message.Explanation: This most likely indicates an error with the implementation of the resource adapter. The resource adapter called the lazyEnlist() method with a null value for the ManagedConnection.
Message.UserResponse: Visit the support web site for the provider of the resource adapter. The resource adapter code has passed a null value to the lazyEnlist() method. See section 7.14.2 of the JCA 1.5 specification for more information on the Lazy Transaction Enlistment optimization.

Message.MsgText: UNABLE_TO_FIND_CLASS_J2CA0200=J2CA0200E: The Connection Manager was unable to find the class {0}.
Message.Explanation: The connection manager was unable to find the given class.
Message.UserResponse: Check that the associated XA resource provider is configured, and restart the server. The resource can then be unconfigured, and the server can be stopped.

Message.MsgText: ERROR_GETTING_PROPERTIES_PATH_J2CA0115=J2CA0115W: {0} occurred getting the absolute path to %WAS_HOME%\properties.
Message.Explanation: An internal error has occurred.
Message.UserResponse: If the problem persists, additional information might be available if you search for the message ID on the following Web sites: WebSphere Application Server Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/was/support/ WebSphere Application Server for z/OS Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/zos_os390/support/ .

Message.MsgText: INCOMPATIBLE_CLASS_FILE_IN_RA_J2CA0248=J2CA0248E: An exception occurred while loading resource adapter class {0}. The class might have been compiled with a newer version of Java than the application server is using. The exception was: {1}
Message.Explanation: Resource adapter classes compiled with a newer version of Java than the server is running can have class incompatibility issues.
Message.UserResponse: Verify that the resource adapter is intended to run on the version of Java which the application server is using.

Message.MsgText: MULTIPLE_CALLERPRINCIPALCALLBACKS_NOT_SUPPORTED_J2CA0676=J2CA0676E: The supplied security context provided multiple instances of a JASPIC CallerPrincipalCallback to establish the security context of the work instance.
Message.Explanation: The WorkManager expects the security context to supply exactly zero or one instance of a JASPIC CallerPrincipalCallback while establishing the security context of the work instance.
Message.UserResponse: Contact the resource adapter vendor to determine why the resource adapter provides multiple instances of the CallerPrincipalCallback.

Message.MsgText: VARIABLE_OUT_OF_RANGE_J2CA0170=J2CA0170E: Internal error. The variable {0} on DataSource or ConnectionFactory {1} has gone out of its acceptable range.
Message.Explanation: This exception is unexpected. The cause is not immediately known.
Message.UserResponse: If the problem persists, additional information might be available if you search for the message ID on the following Web sites: WebSphere Application Server Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/was/support/ WebSphere Application Server for z/OS Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/zos_os390/support/ .

Message.MsgText: AO_BIND_FAILED_J2CA0039=J2CA0039E: Failed to bind an Administered Object to the namespace with JNDI name {0}. The associated Resource Adapter key is {1}.
Message.Explanation: This exception is unexpected. The cause is not immediately known.
Message.UserResponse: If the problem persists, additional information might be available if you search for the message ID on the following Web sites: WebSphere Application Server Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/was/support/ WebSphere Application Server for z/OS Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/zos_os390/support/ .

Message.MsgText: FAILED_TO_OBTAIN_LOCALTRAN_J2CA0077=J2CA0077E: An exception was caught while trying to obtain a javax.resource.cci.LocalTransaction from a ManagedConnection for resource {1}. The exception is: {0}
Message.Explanation: The connection manager was unable to obtain a LocalTransaction from the resource adapter. This indicates a problem with the resource adapter.
Message.UserResponse: Look for error messages from the resource adapter to identify the problem.

Message.MsgText: FAILED_TO_FIND_RA_J2CA0202=J2CA0202E: Internal Error: Failed to find the RAWrapperImpl instance associated with the following key {0}. Throwing exception {1}
Message.Explanation: This exception is unexpected. The cause is not immediately known.
Message.UserResponse: If the problem persists, additional information might be available if you search for the message ID on the following Web sites: WebSphere Application Server Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/was/support/ WebSphere Application Server for z/OS Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/zos_os390/support/ .

Message.MsgText: RA_OP_FAILED_J2CA0150=J2CA0150E: The ResourceAdapter {0} failed to {1} because the ResourceAdapter was not found.
Message.Explanation: The given resource adapter could not be found to perform the operation. This might be because it was not started or has already been shut down.
Message.UserResponse: Check that the MBean that you are using is valid.

Message.MsgText: FAILED_DOPRIVILEGED_J2CA0060=J2CA0060E: PrivilegedActionException calling doPrivileged: {0}
Message.Explanation: This is a security runtime error.
Message.UserResponse: If the problem persists, additional information might be available if you search for the message ID on the following Web sites: WebSphere Application Server Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/was/support/ WebSphere Application Server for z/OS Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/zos_os390/support/ .

Message.MsgText: INTERNAL_TARGET_ADAPTER_J2CA0652=J2CA0652E: WebSphere internal adapters are not updateable.
Message.Explanation: The WebSphere internal resource adapters are not updateable through the RAR Update framework.
Message.UserResponse: None

Message.MsgText: ZOS_ONLY_CUSTOM_PROP_J2CA0694=J2CA0694W: The {0} custom property defined for the resource with JNDI name of {1} can be defined for the application server only on the z/OS system. This custom property is ignored.
Message.Explanation: The custom property is specific to the application server on a z/OS system. Because the system on which the application server is running is not a z/OS system, the custom property being defined is ignored.
Message.UserResponse: Verify that the custom property being defined has no restrictions.

Message.MsgText: COMPARE_MULTIPLE_RA_NO_ACCESS_J2CA0661=J2CA0661E: Monitor privilege is required for all Resource Adapters being compared. Monitor privilege was not found for the {0} Resource Adapter. The command executor could not perform a comparison.
Message.Explanation: The command executor does not have the monitor privilege for the specified Resource Adapter configuration ID.
Message.UserResponse: Obtain monitor access privileges from the system administrator for the Resource Adapter that was specified and any related resources.

Message.MsgText: RA_START_FAILED_J2CA0128=J2CA0128E: An Exception occurred while trying to start ResourceAdapter {0}. The exception is: {1}
Message.Explanation: An exception occurred trying to start a resource adapter. This occurred during the reading of the configuration properties or during the call to start the class for this resource adapter.
Message.UserResponse: Check the exception and other error messages for more details. Take action based on the exception or the other errors in the log.

Message.MsgText: BUCKET_SERVER_WIDE_J2CA0123=J2CA0123I: Server-wide pool properties were read from {0}.
Message.Explanation: This is an informational message.
Message.UserResponse: There is no user action required.

Message.MsgText: INVALID_GROUP_ENCOUNTERED_J2CA0678=J2CA0678W: Group {0} does not belong to the domain associated to the application.
Message.Explanation: The security context transferred with the work instance provided a group name that does not exist in the realm (user registry) of the security domain associated to the application. The WorkManager obtained the invalid group name from an instance of a JASPIC GroupPrincipalCallback, whenever an instance is supplied by the resource adapter.
Message.UserResponse: Check if the group is from the same realm by confirming the group existence in the user registry for that realm.If the group is from a different realm, contact the resource adapter vendor because the WorkManager does not support groups from different realms.

Message.MsgText: RA_METHOD_FAILED_J2CA0089=J2CA0089E: The method {0} on ResourceAdapter JavaBean {1} failed with the following exception: {2}
Message.Explanation: The resource adapter created an exception. This could indicate a problem with the resource adapter.
Message.UserResponse: Check the exception for more information.

Message.MsgText: INVALID_EJB_COMPONENT_J2CA0099=J2CA0099E: Invalid EJB component: Cannot use an EJB module with version {0} and CMP version {1} using {2}.
Message.Explanation: An attempt to run an EJB component that is incompatible with the application server was detected.
Message.UserResponse: Evaluate the EJB version and CMP version that is supported by the EJB component. Correct any potential problems and redeploy the components.

Message.MsgText: ALERT_POOL_LOW_EFF_J2CA0502=J2CA0502W: Pool Low Efficiency Alert for ConnectionFactory or DataSoure {0}. The average efficiency of all the connections is {1} which has dropped below the configured alert threshold of {2} percent efficiency during the past approximate {3} minutes.
Message.Explanation: You have configured the monitoring of your data source or connection factory for low average connection usage efficiency. The usage efficiency is the total amount of time the connections are used to interact with the the backend data source, divided by the total amount of time the connections have been held, and averaged for the number of connections at any point in time in the pool. It is expressed as a percentage.
Message.UserResponse: If the efficiency is lower than expected, examine the application for possible causes. You might want to configure the Connection Low Efficiency Alert with a callstack capture enabled to further isolate the specific application usage which is not efficient.

Message.MsgText: NULL_PROVIDER_OBJECTNAME_J2CA0113=J2CA0113W: The ObjectName for the provider MBean was null. This will cause an error with PMI and will prevent the Connection Factory or Data Source MBean from being linked to its J2CResourceadapter or JDBCProvider (respectively) "parent" MBean.
Message.Explanation: An internal error occurred. The MBeans will not be linked correctly. This does not effect the use of the connection factory or the data source, but it might cause an error if you are using PMI.
Message.UserResponse: If the problem persists, additional information might be available if you search for the message ID on the following Web sites: WebSphere Application Server Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/was/support/ WebSphere Application Server for z/OS Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/zos_os390/support/ .

Message.MsgText: ALERT_CONN_WAIT_TO_J2CA0506=J2CA0506W: Connection Wait Time-out Alert for ConnectionFactory or DataSource {0}. The number of ConnectionWaitTimeoutExceptions issued has exceeded your configured threshold of {1} in less then the configured alert time of {2} minutes .
Message.Explanation: Connection factories or data sources can be configured to wait a certain amount of time for a connection to become amenable. If this time is exceeded, a ConnectionWaitTimeoutException is issued. This alert can be configured to count the number of ConnectionWaitTimeoutExceptions over a given interval and raise an alert if the threshold is exceeded.
Message.UserResponse: Refer to the documentation for on ConnectionWaitTimeoutExceptions for more details.

Message.MsgText: CONN_FAILOVER_PRIMARY_AND_ALTERNATE_UNAVAILABLE_J2CA0681=J2CA0681I: The configured primary resource with a JNDI name of {0} and the configured alternate resource that has a JNDI name of {1} are unavailable.
Message.Explanation: Connection management has detected that both the configured primary and alternate resources have become unavailable. Requests cannot be rerouted.
Message.UserResponse: Contact your database or system administrator to determine the state of the resources in question.

Message.MsgText: CREATE_RESOURCE_ADAPTER_DD_EXCP_J2CA0001=J2CA0001E: An exception occurred while trying to read the Resource Adapter Deployment Descriptor for {0} : {1}.
Message.Explanation: This indicates a problem with the Systems Management configuration of the resource adapter. A Deployment Descriptor does exist for this resource adapter, but it is not in the right format to read in and process.
Message.UserResponse: If the problem persists, additional information might be available if you search for the message ID on the following Web sites: WebSphere Application Server Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/was/support/ WebSphere Application Server for z/OS Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/zos_os390/support/ .

Message.MsgText: AUTH_MECH_PREFERENCE_NOT_SUPPORTED_J2CA0104=J2CA0104E: Authentication mechanism preference {0} is not supported by the Resource Adapter for ConnectionFactory or DataSource {1}.
Message.Explanation: The authentication mechanism must be one of those specified in the element [authentication-mechanism-type] in the resource adapter's ra.xml file.
Message.UserResponse: Use the administrative console to specify an authentication mechanism that is supported by the resource adapter.

Message.MsgText: REGISTER_WITH_SYNCHRONIZATION_EXCP_J2CA0026=J2CA0026E: Method {0} caught {1} while trying to register the Resource Adapter with the Synchronization Manager for the current transaction, and threw a {2}.
Message.Explanation: There was a problem processing the given method. The interface defines specific exceptions that can be created, so the exception that was caught was mapped to the exception that was created. The processing within the method did not complete successfully.
Message.UserResponse: Check that the business logic of the application is properly catching the exception that was created and contains the necessary recovery logic. Also check the log files for earlier errors that caused the exception.

Message.MsgText: PARK_OR_REASSOCIATE_FAILED_W_J2CA0083=J2CA0083W: Method {0} failed while trying to execute method {1} on the ConnectionManager. Failing handle is: {2}. Caught the following Exception: {3}
Message.Explanation: The ConnectionHandleManager caught an exception while trying to perform a handle re-association operation. This is expected behavior following a transaction time-out, but in other cases this could be an internal error.
Message.UserResponse: Look for messages indicating that a transaction has timed out. If time-outs are occurring you can ignore this message. If you do not see evidence of a transaction time-out, contact support.

Message.MsgText: NULL_MANAGED_CONNECTION_J2CA0015=J2CA0015E: The Connection Pool Manager could not allocate a Managed Connection from resource {0}.
Message.Explanation: The pool manager could not allocate a managed connection. This might be due to the properties associated with the pool manager (such as, maximum connections were exceeded). A NULL managed connection was returned by the pool manager.
Message.UserResponse: If the problem persists, additional information might be available if you search for the message ID on the following Web sites: WebSphere Application Server Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/was/support/ WebSphere Application Server for z/OS Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/zos_os390/support/ .

Message.MsgText: INCOMPATIBLE_JCA_VERSIONS_J2CA0660=J2CA0660I: The new RAR file is not compatible with the Resource Adapter. The JCA Spec versions of the Resource Adapter and RAR are different. Resource Adapter JCA version: {0}. RAR File JCA Version: {1}.
Message.Explanation: Updating to a RAR file that is of a different JCA spec version than the Resource Adapter is not supported.
Message.UserResponse: Choose a resource adapter and RAR file which are compatible for update.

Message.MsgText: CONN_FAILOVER_INVALID_ALTERNATE_SETUP_J2CA0689=J2CA0689W: An alternate resource with a JNDI name of {1} has an alternate resource with a JNDI name of {2}. Resource failover for the alternate resource with a JNDI name of {3} is disabled.
Message.Explanation: Recursive failover to multiple resources is not supported. Failover support for alternate resources that themselves have alternate resources is disabled.
Message.UserResponse: Read the documentation available on resource routing for correctly enabling failover support.

Message.MsgText: CUSTOM_CREDENTIALS_MISSING_J2CA0668=J2CA0668E: The WorkManager was unable to populate the execution subject with the caller principal or credentials necessary to establish the security context for this work instance.
Message.Explanation: The JASPIC callback handler of the WorkManager failed to populate the principal or custom credentials of the execution subject because an exception occurred while processing the JASPIC callbacks supplied by the resource adapter.
Message.UserResponse: Check the FFDC and server logs that were emitted immediately prior to message J2CA0672E to determine the cause. If the cause cannot be determined from the prior error messages, collect diagnostic data and visit the IBM support web site for more information.

Message.MsgText: DUPLICATE_WORK_CONTEXT_J2CA0691=J2CA0691E: The {0} operation failed because the resource adapter {1} requires a Work Context type {2} that is declared more than once in the RAR metadata.
Message.Explanation: The Application Server supports unique Work Context types. The RAR failed to deploy because two or more RequiredWorkContext elements, declared in either the RAR deployment descriptor or an @Connector RAR metadata annotation, specify the same Work Context type.
