Message.UserResponse: Contact the resource adapter vendor and obtain a new RAR module containing metadata that declares only unique required Work Context types supported by the Application Server.

Message.MsgText: CREATE_SERIALIZABLE_EXCP_J2CA0017=J2CA0017I: An exception occurred while building the serializable for JNDI deployment of {0} : {1}. This error was absorbed and a null returned from the method.
Message.Explanation: There was a problem creating the serializable object to be stored in the JNDI name space for the named resource. This problem will be detected and logged as an error later in the processing.
Message.UserResponse: Refer to the additional information that is provided to find related error messages and information from the log file.

Message.MsgText: UNSUPPORTED_WORK_CONTEXT_J2CA0686=J2CA0686E: The {0} operation failed because the resource adapter {1} requires a Work Context type {2} that is not supported by the Application Server.
Message.Explanation: The Application Server supports the following three Work Context types: javax.resource.spi.work.TransactionContext, javax.resource.spi.work.SecurityContext, and javax.resource.spi.work.HintsContext. The RAR failed to deploy because a RequiredWorkContext element, declared in either the RAR deployment descriptor or an @Connector RAR meta-data annotation, specifies a Work Context type that is not supported by the Application Server.
Message.UserResponse: Contact the resource adapter vendor and obtain a new RAR module that declares only required Work Context types supported by the Application Server.

Message.MsgText: NODE_UPDATE_SUCCESSFUL_J2CA0653=J2CA0653I: The update of {0} to RAR file {1} was successful, a full binary and configuration update was performed. The configuration has been saved.
Message.Explanation: When updating a node scoped resource adapter, an update is performed on the configuration and the binary files. A configuration save is automatically done.
Message.UserResponse: Update any copies of this resource adapter if they have not been updated already.

Message.MsgText: UNRECOGNIZED_VALUE_J2CA0243=J2CA0243E: WebSphere Application Server does not recognize a value of {0} for property {1} which is configured on resource {2}.
Message.Explanation: The value of the property is not understood by WebSphere Application Server.
Message.UserResponse: Correct the configuration error.

Message.MsgText: NO_GROUPS_FOR_UNIQUEID_J2CA0679=J2CA0679W: No groups were found for the user with the uniqueId {0}
Message.Explanation: The security context transferred with the work instance provided a user that does not belong to any of the groups defined in the user registry.
Message.UserResponse: There is no user action required.

Message.MsgText: CREATE_MANAGED_CONNECTION_FACTORY_EXCP_J2CA0013=J2CA0013I: An exception occurred while trying to create ManagedConnectionFactory for {0} : {1}.
Message.Explanation: A problem occured creating the ManagedConnectionFactory from the stored Reference in the JNDI name space.
Message.UserResponse: Refer to the additional information that is provided to find related error messages and information from the activity.log file.

Message.MsgText: UNABLE_TO_INITIALIZE_XATERM_J2CA0136=J2CA0136E: Unable to create an XATerminator, due to an exception. The exception will not be re-thrown. The exception is: {0}.
Message.Explanation: The BootstrapContext was unable to return an XATerminator to the resource adapter.
Message.UserResponse: See the exception and previous log entries for more details.

Message.MsgText: ERROR_DESTROY_MC_J2CA0063=J2CA0063W: Encountered an error while destroying the ManagedConnection {0} : {1}
Message.Explanation: The destroy operation on a managed connection failed after recovery.
Message.UserResponse: If the problem persists, additional information might be available if you search for the message ID on the following Web sites: WebSphere Application Server Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/was/support/ WebSphere Application Server for z/OS Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/zos_os390/support/ .

Message.MsgText: CONNECTION_DETAILS_J2CA0070=J2CA0070W: Component {0}, is holding {1} number of connection(s).
Message.Explanation: A number of connections are being held by a component. This message typically follows the exception for an unavailable resource unavailable when a getConnection request failed in the application code.
Message.UserResponse: Check if one or more components are holding connections excessively. The application might not be closing connection. If a number of connections appear to be working, increase the "max pool size."

Message.MsgText: BEAN_VALIDATION_FACTORY_BUILD_FAILED_J2CA1006=J2CA1006E: An exception occurred while attempting to build the ValidatorFactory for a resource adapter having archive path {0} : {1}. Bean Validation has been disabled for resource adapters having the archive path.
Message.Explanation: This exception is unexpected and indicates a problem with the BeanValidationService, the Bean Validation provider, or the RAR deployment. The cause may not be immediately determined.
Message.UserResponse: Check the FFDC logs. If the problem appears due to the RAR configuration, reassmeble the RAR per the WebSphere Application Server InfoCenter and redeploy it. If the problem is due to a failure in a Bean Validation implementation other than that supplied by WebSphere Application Server, contact the Bean Validation provider. CMSG0002

Message.MsgText: ADMINOBJECT_IMPLEMENTATION_REMOVED_J2CA0641=J2CA0641I: The new RAR file is not compatible with the Resource Adapter. An AdminObject class {2} was removed, and there is a configured Admin Object that uses the removed type. AdminObject name: {0}, JNDI Name: {1}.
Message.Explanation: The new RAR file has removed an Administrative Object implementation, and the Resource Adapter currently has at least one configured AdminObject that makes use of the removed implementation. This makes the Resource Adapter and RAR incompatible for update.
Message.UserResponse: Delete the Administrative Objects that use the implementation class that was removed. The configuration for these objects will be lost.

Message.MsgText: NO_MAPPING_CONFIG_ALIAS_J2CA0144=J2CA0144W: No mappingConfigAlias found for ConnectionFactory or DataSource {0}.
Message.Explanation: The component is using container-managed authentication, but no mappingConfigAlias was specified. DefaultPrincipalMapping will be used.
Message.UserResponse: This is likely a scripting error with the specified ConnectionFactory or DataSource, or its corresponding CMPConnectorFactory.

Message.MsgText: INCOMPATIBLE_PROP_VALUE_J2CA0663=J2CA0663W: User input value {0} on the new RAR file property {1} is not compatible with the expected type {2}. The default value {3} specified in ra.xml will be used instead.
Message.Explanation: Runtime errors may result from properties whose values are incompatible with their defined type.
Message.UserResponse: If the default value is not desired, edit the connection factory, activation spec or admin object on which the property is found.

Message.MsgText: INVALID_SERVLET_LEVEL_J2CA0106=J2CA0106E: A 5.0 Data Source was attempted to be used in a WebModule that was not level 2.3.
Message.Explanation: 5.0 Data sources are only supported for WebModules with servlet level 2.3.
Message.UserResponse: Evaluate whether the servlet in question can be migrated to level 2.3. If so, migrate the application and redeploy it. If it cannot be migrated, the servlet must use a Websphere Application Server 4.0 data source.

Message.MsgText: AUTH_MECH_PREFERENCE_NOT_SPECIFIED_J2CA0105=J2CA0105W: Authentication mechanism preference not specified for ConnectionFactory or DataSource {0}.
Message.Explanation: This might be a symptom of a hand-modified resources.xml document. A subject might contain null credentials, or the resource adapter mightnot accept this subject.
Message.UserResponse: Use the administrative console to specify an authentication mechanism that is supported by the resource adapter. If the resource adapter does not support any authentication mechanism, choose "None."

Message.MsgText: INVALID_USER_NAME_IN_PRINCIPAL_J2CA0670=J2CA0670E: The WorkManager was unable to establish the security context for the work instance, because the resource adapter provided a caller identity {0}, that does not belong to the security domain associated with the application.
Message.Explanation: The security context provided by the work instance contains a user name that does not exist in the realm (user registry) of the security domain associated to the application. The WorkManager obtained the invalid user name from an instance of a JASPIC CallerPrincipalCallback, whenever an instance is supplied by the resource adapter, or from the execution subject returned by method setupSecurityContext.
Message.UserResponse: In case the user is from the same realm, check if the user exists in the user registry for that realm. In case the user is from a different realm, contact the resource adapter vendor since the WorkManager does not currently support users from different realms.

Message.MsgText: METHOD_FAILED_J2CA0132=J2CA0132E: Method {0} caught exception {1}.
Message.Explanation: The method caught an exception that is most likely an internal error.
Message.UserResponse: If the problem persists, additional information might be available if you search for the message ID on the following Web sites: WebSphere Application Server Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/was/support/ WebSphere Application Server for z/OS Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/zos_os390/support/ .

Message.MsgText: BEAN_VALIDATION_VALIDATOR_FAILED_J2CA1008=J2CA1008E: An exception occurred while Validator {0} was attempting to validate the RAR JavaBean instance {2} : {1}. Bean Validation constraints will not be validated before placing the instance into service.
Message.Explanation: This exception is unexpected and indicates a problem with the Validator implementation. The cause may not be immediately determined.
Message.UserResponse: Check the FFDC and system logs. If the symptom indicates a failure in a Validator implementation other than that supplied by WebSphere Application Server, contact the Bean Validation provider. CMSG0002

Message.MsgText: CONNECTION_FACTORY_IMPLEMENTATION_CHANGED_1.0_J2CA0658=J2CA0658I: The new RAR file is not compatible with the JCA 1.0 Resource Adapter. The ManagedConnectionFactory implementation class has changed.
Message.Explanation: The new RAR file has a different ManagedConnectionFactory implementation class. This makes the JCA 1.0 Resource Adapter and RAR incompatible for update.
Message.UserResponse: Choose a resource adapter and RAR file which are compatible for update.

Message.MsgText: ALERT_PRETEST_BLOCK_J2CA0515=J2CA0515W: Pretest Block Mode Alert for ConnectionFactory or DataSource {0}. Connection Pretest function has stopped connection request blocking.
Message.Explanation: Data sources and connection factories can be configured to pretest connections for getConnection requests to ensure the health of the connection based on the configuration thresholds. If a connection is not responding the connection manager will block all requests for new connections until it can receive a functioning connection. If the pretesting of connections has been configured and this alert is enabled, this message indicates that you have exited the pretest connection blocking state, and the creation of new connections is now allowed.
Message.UserResponse: If your connection factory or data source is spending excessive time in a blocked state, you might want to look for underlying problems with the backend with which you are trying to communicate.

Message.MsgText: BEAN_VALIDATION_FAILED_J2CA0238=J2CA0238E: JavaBean {0} failed Bean Validation due to one or more invalid configuration settings indicated in the following list of constraint violations: {1}
Message.Explanation: The value of one or more configuration properties of the JavaBean instance violates the specified Bean Validation constraints.
Message.UserResponse: Consult the documentation of the Resource Adapter provider to determine valid values for each configuration property indicated by the constraint violations and configure each property accordingly.

Message.MsgText: HA_CAPABILITY_MISMATCH_J2CA0310=J2CA0310W: Resource adapter {0} is configured with high availability setting {1}, but the resource adapter method returnHACapability() returned high availability capability {2}. The high availability capability returned by the Resource adapter method will be used.
Message.Explanation: The resource adapter is configured with a high availability setting that differs from the high availability capability that is supported by the resource adapter. The connection manager will use the high availability capability that is supported by the resource adapter.
Message.UserResponse: Use the administrative console or the wsadmin tool to configure the resource adapter with a high availability capability that is supported by the resource adapter.

Message.MsgText: INACTIVE_SUPPORT_USED_J2CA0082=J2CA0082W: InactiveConnectionSupport option {0} used by resource {2}. This differs from the desired option of {1}.
Message.Explanation: The resource adapter does not support the specified InactiveConnectionSupport setting.
Message.UserResponse: Visit the support site the developer of the resource adapter.

Message.MsgText: DEST_LOOKUP_FAILED_J2CA0146=J2CA0146W: The lookup of the Destination with JNDI Name {0} failed due to exception {1}.
Message.Explanation: The JNDI lookup of the destination failed. This could be caused by one of the following conditions: (1) the destination referred to by the specified JNDI name has not been configured, (2) the JNDI Name is incorrect, or (3) some other problem exists as indicated by the exception.
Message.UserResponse: Check that the destination is configured for the resource adapter that you are using. The destination can be configured as part of the activation specification configuration or during the MDB step during deployment of the application. Ensure that the specified JNDI Name matches the name specified when you create the Destination AdminObject on the resource adapter.

Message.MsgText: ALERT_PRETEST_BLOCK_J2CA0505=J2CA0505W: Pretest Block Mode Alert for ConnectionFactory or DataSource {0}. Connection Pretest function has started connection request blocking.
Message.Explanation: Data sources and connection factories can be configured to pretest connections for getConnection requests to ensure the health of the connection based on the configuration thresholds. If a connection is not responding, the connection manager will block all requests for new connections until it can receive a functioning connection. If the pretesting of connections has been configured and this alert is enabled, this message indicates that you have entered the pretest connection blocking state, and the creation of new connections is not allowed.
Message.UserResponse: If your connection factory or data source is spending excessive time in a blocked state, you might want to see if there is an underlying problem with the backend with which you are trying to communicate.

Message.MsgText: DUPLICATE_CONTEXTS_FOUND_J2CA0224=J2CA0224E: Multiple instances of the same WorkContext {0} provided.
Message.Explanation: Resource adapter provided multiple WorkContexts that implement the same WorkContext type.
Message.UserResponse: Eliminate duplicates from a list of WorkContexts returned by a Work that implements WorkContextProvider before submitting the Work.

Message.MsgText: CANNOT_LOAD_TM_J2CA0227=J2CA0227E: An error occurred when loading a Transaction Manager from class {0}
Message.Explanation: The Transaction Manager cannot be loaded from the class specified in com.ibm.ws390.jta.TransactionManager system property. This will cause a subsequent failure when creating an instance of the Transaction Manager.
Message.UserResponse: If the problem persists, additional information might be available if you search for the message ID on the following Web sites: WebSphere Application Server Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/was/support/ WebSphere Application Server for z/OS Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/zos_os390/support/ .

Message.MsgText: TRAN_RECOVERY_REG_FAILED_J2CA0084=J2CA0084W: Transaction recovery registration failed for ResourceAdapter {0} with exception {1}.
Message.Explanation: Registration with the transaction service for the recovery of transactions for inbound messages to this resource adapter did not complete successfully. Subsequent transactions with the use inbound transactions might also fail.
Message.UserResponse: If the problem persists, additional information might be available if you search for the message ID on the following Web sites: WebSphere Application Server Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/was/support/ WebSphere Application Server for z/OS Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/zos_os390/support/ .

Message.MsgText: MULTIPLE_RA_INSTANCE_VIOLATION_J2CA0205=J2CA0205E: The Connection Manager has detected a request to create ResourceAdapter {0}, when a pre-existing ResourceAdapter {1} that uses the same class names has been configured to run as a single instance.
Message.Explanation: A resource adapter can be configured to tolerate only one instance of their resource adapter class being instantiated within a JVM. You will receive this message if you have more than one such resource adapter instance configured to run on a given server. This can happen in one of the following circumstances: 1) You deployed more than one Application which embeds the same resource adapter; 2) you have one stand-alone resource adapter deployed in a server and an application embeds the same resource adapter on the same server, or 3) you installed more than one instance of the same resource adapter as stand-alone (shared by all applications).
Message.UserResponse: Change your configuration such that the two resource adapters are not deployed to the same server.

Message.MsgText: ACTIVATION_FAILED_J2CA0520=J2CA0520W: The Message Endpoint resume operation failed for ActivationSpec {0} and MDB Application {1} because the endpoint is currently activated or stopped, or an unexpected exception occurred activating the endpoint.
Message.Explanation: Message endpoints that are activated or stopped cannot be resumed.
Message.UserResponse: Check that the message endpoint is deactivated before invoking the resume operation. If the endpoint is deactivated, see the exception and other log entries for more details.

Message.MsgText: CREATE_MAPPINGMODULE_PROPERTIES_EXCP_J2CA0095=J2CA0095E: Unable to obtain authentication information for J2CConnectionFactory {0} : {1}
Message.Explanation: The MappingModule object could not be read.
Message.UserResponse: See the FFDC logs for more information.

Message.MsgText: CONN_FAILOVER_PRIMARY_UNAVAILABLE_J2CA0680=J2CA0680I: The configured primary resource with a JNDI name of {0} is unavailable. New requests will be routed to the configured alternate resource that has a JNDI name of {1}.
Message.Explanation: Connection Management has detected that the configured primary resource is unavailable. New requests will be routed to the configured alternate resource.
Message.UserResponse: Contact your database or system administrator to determine the state of the resource in question.

Message.MsgText: ILLEGAL_STATE_EXCEPTION_J2CA0079=J2CA0079E: Method {0} has detected an internal illegal state and is throwing an IllegalStateException. The exception is: {1}
Message.Explanation: The connection manager has detected an internal error.
Message.UserResponse: If the problem persists, additional information might be available if you search for the message ID on the following Web sites: WebSphere Application Server Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/was/support/ WebSphere Application Server for z/OS Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/zos_os390/support/ .
